results.description:
On Tuesday, on January 5, your Boston Network Users Group, BNUG, will meet at Mass Bay Community College in Wellesley Hills.  As usual, admission is FREE and open to all.  Munchies and Intermingling (M&I) starts at 6:30pm, the meeting will start at 7pm and must end by 8:30pm. 

IMPORTANT: You need to have a (free) parking permit and directions.  These are located online (print yours) at http://www.bnug.org/parkingpermit

Please let me know if you plan to come or even if you may come so we can have enough space and munchies.  Thanks.

If you've tried Windows 10, maybe you'd like to let us know how your experience has been, at the meeting.

About the meeting: 

At this meeting, Adam will be leading a discussion about email. Sitting as it does at the center of business and home life, the subject of email is worth exploring in depth.

We'll begin by talking about the origins of email, and how it evolved from a quick add-on to the ARPANET in the eighties to become a global phenomenon, with 2.5 million emails sent every second (and yes, 1.8 million of those are spam).

We'll then talk about the different ways of using email, including webmail such as Gmail, mail clients like Outlook, and mixed methods. We'll discuss how to set up an email system that makes sense for you or your customer, starting with the domain name, then choosing the host and client, and taking steps to prevent threats that include spam, lockouts and break-ins. We'll do an in-depth exploration of Outlook as a tool for professionally managing mail throughout its long lifecycle, from arrival to long-term archiving.

We'll also talk about how email can be an effective tool for outreach and business growth, taking as an example a pro bono email list for a non-profit that has also served a fruitful for-profit advertising function.

See: http://bnug.org/emailtopics.html for topics he will discuss.


About the speaker Adam Frost

Adam Frost works as the coordinator of Computer Care and Learning, an educationally-oriented computer helping company. While some of our colleagues and competitors encourage “outsourcing” of all computer care to them, we encourage our customers to get to know their computers and train their staff in computer care. We find this helps our customers develop deep skills in computer use as a key part of business strategy and action.

Computer Care and Learning has a longstanding internship program, where we train people to be skilled computer helpers, and we also help run the Get Connected! clinic, which provides refurbished computers to customers with low and moderate incomes.  

To learn more, come to the meeting, call Adam's company  at[masked], or email [masked]

Regards,

-steve

Steve Isenberg

President, BNUG

Dr. Gill is a seasoned entrepreneur, CEO, investor, and board member. He is a longtime investor and director at Launchpad Venture Group, the largest angel investing group in the Northeast. Dr. Gill is active on the board of several startups. Dr. Gill's most recent operational role was President & CEO of TruTouchTechnologies, an alcohol testing and biometric device company, where he remains a board member. Prior to that he has been President & CEO at Genome Therapeutics, ActiveCyte, AnVil, Signet and ProNAi. He also held executive positions at Unilever and British Technology Group. He has executed business strategies, moved candidates into clinical trials, overseen M&A activities and much more. His degrees are inPhysiology and Biochemistry, Chemistry plus a PhD in Endocrinology.

Molly Farison, Co-founder and CEO at Lilypad Scales (www.lilypadscales.com), is an experienced electrical engineer and product developer with significant product development history. She has experience in consumer and healthcare markets working with factories in the U.S. from starting her present company, Lilypad Scales, which developed from scratch a functional and durable product with 5-star reviews on Amazon.com. Molly also led two capital raises and gave presentations that landed her company a spot in MassChallenge in 2013 and won the Babson BETA Challenge ($20k prize) in 2014. Molly manages an interdisciplinary team that has included engineers, doctors, salespeople, and graphic designers. Molly had prior work experience at Altaeros Energies, Rockwell Automation and NASA. She graduated Olin College of Engineering, with a B.S., Electrical and Computer Engineering, and was co-inventor on the patent relating to Lilypad Scales' first product, the Lilypad Scale for Manual Wheelchairs.

Moderator: 

Robert Adelson, business and tax attorney, partner at Boston law firm of Engel & Schultz LLP (www.ExecutiveEmploymentAttorney.com), and Chairman of IEEE Boston Entrepreneurs’ Network.  Rob has been an attorney for over 30 years specialized in business, tax, stock and options, employment, contracts, financings, trademarks and intellectual property.  Rob began as an associate at major New York City  law firms before returning home to Boston in 1985 where he has since been a partner in small and medium sized firms before joining his present firm in 2004.  Rob represents entrepreneurs, start-ups and small companies, independent contractors and employees and executives.  Rob is a frequent speaker on business law topics and author of numerous articles published in Boston Business Journal, Mass High Tech and other publications. He has been named among the “Top 20 Boston Startup Lawyers” by ChubbyBrain.com, a website that provides tools for entrepreneurs. Rob has been on the ENET Board since 2002 and Chairman since 2009 and is also a Co-Founder and Board member of the 128 Innovation Capital Group. He holds degrees from Boston University, B.A., summa cum laude, Northwestern University (Chicago), J.D., Law Review, and New York University,  LL.M. in Taxation.

Location Constant Contact, 1601 Trapelo Rd., 1st Floor Great Room, Waltham (Exit 28, I-95/Route 128)

Registration : http://enet.camp7.org/event-2017595/Registration

Member Rate – Free

MDG Member – $15.00 (USD)

Non-ENET Member Rate – $20.00 (USD)

Student – $10.00 (USD)

results.description:
Special Guest Speaker - Jason Roberts

No doubt about it – foreclosure properties are the wave of the present – and the future. The truth is, they’re not going anywhere any time soon. There are endless desperate sellers right in your own back yard who would LOVE to have you fix their problem by negotiating a pennies-on-the-dollar payoff with their banks – and don’t care one bit that you’ll make tens of thousands of dollars in the process.

The problem is, most short sale education makes it sound like every deal you do will be quick, easy, painless, and successful – and according to Jason Roberts (and many other real life short sale investors we know), that’s just not the whole truth. Jason is one of the few short sale/pre-foreclosure experts you’ll ever meet who’s honest about the pros and cons – and tells you how to meet the challenges of this strategy head-on and he will explain:

Why some short sale deals are no-brainer money-makers and some are a complete waste of your time – and how to tell the difference BEFORE you spend a bunch of time “negotiating” deals that should be left for dead.Why good systems are key to working multiple short sales at once – and why working multiple deals at once is more profitable and easier than doing one at a time.How to identify the right sellers, properties, and lenders to work with, so you can make a 6-figure income negotiating short sales this year!And much, much more!


++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

The Boston Real Estate Investors Association  is open to real estate investors of all experience levels who want to meet and continuously learn from other investors and real estate professionals. Each meeting features knowledgeable speakers to guide members through new and relevant topics relating to the many aspects of Real Estate Investment. Past events have covered Why invest in Real Estate?, Foreclosures, Self-directed IRA's, 1031 Exchanges, and Creative Tax Strategies.

It's an opportunity to network with others who share similar goals & needs, to learn about unique & hot properties, to find ways of obtaining & utilizing different sources of capital, and so much more!
results.name: How to Make a Staggering Income Flipping Pre-Foreclosures!

results.description:
THE HAPPINESS OF CONTENTMENT

a meditation class series 

TUESDAYS | JANUARY 5th - 26th


7:00 - 8:30pm

with Kadampa Buddhist Teacher, Kyle Davis

In our search for happiness, we use our time and energy seeking so many different things. We may change our job, our partner, our home, our situation, but we will never know real satisfaction until we change our restless, discontented mind. The mind of attachment is the main cause of our discontentment, relationship difficulties and craving.

In this drop-in meditation series we will learn practical methods and meditations that enable us to let go of attachment and find peace in all of our circumstances. Life doesn’t always go as planned but through the practice of contentment we can learn to keep a happy mind in all situations.

Drop in anytime! No need to pre-registration. 

Cost | $10 per class / $5 students & seniors.  Members FREE! 

Location | 179 Green Street – Boston, Jamaica Plain, MA 02130  

meditationINboston.org

For more info please call[masked] or email [masked]

results.description:
Though we might wish we could, we can't always think of everything ourselves. Join Danny and other writers for a chance to engage your writing with a community and get the kind of new, original feedback that gets the writing juices flowing. Before every meeting we'll each submit a short story, section of a novel or other work to be reviewed (up to 10-12 double spaced pages or[masked] words*). Come prepared to give written and verbal feedback on others' work as well as receive feedback on your own. Open to all, but limited to 5 each session (plus organizers) on a first come first serve basis.

Please RSVP and be prepared to submit your work about a week before we meet to give everyone a chance to read. RSVPs will close a few days before the event.

Submissions are hosted on a shared Box.com folder, which requires an email address to access.  If this is your first time joining, let Danny know your preferred email address and he will invite you.

Monthly
Cost is $15

Led by Danny Shain

Danny graduated from Union College with a degree in English, and has spent years working as a copy-editor, freelance writer and blogger.  A follower of technology trends whose reading interests range from the fantastical to the contemporary to the philosophical, Danny is excited to help people refine their writing, express themselves, and build a writing community through this workshop.

*Note: If you'd like to include slightly more than 10-12 pages to provide some context (ie: your chapter ends 1-2 pages later) that's ok, but please indicate which pages you'd like critiqued. Pages beyond that should be submitted as an optional read.

results.description:
This Meetup is intended for intermediate level players or higher, which means:Yankee C and above level, players with firm understanding of game strategy. Should be able to play 5-1 and 6-2 formations, have a good grasp of skills (passing, setting, hitting) and be able to move around to cover areas of the court. Play should consistently be bump-set-spike.



If you'd like to play, please do the following:


1. Send an email to Kory using the following URL: http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=8675200

2. In the message please indicate the date of event and your preferred position so we can make sure we have the right mix. ( If I don't know your position already)

Note that sending an email does not guarantee a spot to play; spots are only guaranteed if you receive a positive confirmation email. We will do our best to make sure the event is co-ed, have setters,  and incorporate a couple new members who want to join as well.

The location for this volleyball meetup is at the Orient Heights Community Center located at 86 Boardman Street in East Boston. Kory and Wing will be hosting these Tuesday night volleyball meetups.

This event is free if you are a member of Boston Community Centers. If not, it's a one-time $20 membership fee that is valid for a year. The Community Center is a short walk away from the Orient Heights T Stop on the Blue Line and also has plenty of parking. When you drive up, turn at the Mariott Hotel Sign and park in the lot or further along the fence.

As always, please remember:

- Respect the RSVP system (Don't show up expecting to play without a confirmed RSVP)

- The gym is open before the event to warm up, so please arrive a little early if you would like to warm up and stretch as we would like to start the game promptly from 7:00PM

- If it looks like you won't be able to make it or will run late please cancel your RSVP in time for someone else to join.  Event day/last minute cancellations and no shows will jeopardize your participation in future events.
results.name: 1/5 Intermediate+ Indoor Volleyball East Boston

results.description:
Ongoing class in Medieval and Renaissance Longsword in the tradition of Johannes Lichtenauer.

The Longsword is the iconic fantasy Knight's sword - a two-handed, straight blade with a cross guard. The weapon may seem to be simple at first but is in reality a weapon of finesse and skill.

The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed. All classes begin with a Strength & Conditioning program designed to physically prepare one for fighting with the sword. Elements develop agility, core stability and power.
results.name: Lichtenauer Longsword

results.description:
Dear Meditators, 

Let's start this new year by creating a vision of peace! Please join us for an evening of Meditation and Blessings dedicated to World Peace. We'll conduct a guided meditation to connect with our inner-peace and expand it to our troubled areas inside and outside us . We'll also conduct targeted blessings/energy channeling for various causes. Each participant will select a cause and everyone will join in sending their positive energies toward materialization of each cause. The power of such joint blessing is palpable and it delivers an unseen yet powerful impact.

Please join us *online* at 7.30pm on Tuesday 12/1 at the following link: 

http://bostonhangout.centersoflight.org/

Or join us *in person* in Cambridge. Please lookup the address at

http://centersoflight.org/locations/boston/

See you on Tuesday to join our intentions for World Peace and send our good will through our spirits.

Rev Christine.
results.name: Peace Meditation and Blessings

results.description:
Meditation practice gives us a chance to step away from the busy-ness of our day-to-day lives. It provides space for us to be free from reaction, from expectation, from doing, and step into the gentle space of being.

This weekly practice consists of 25-30 minutes of guided Vipassana meditation followed by a brief discussion. Vipassana meditation encourages us to experience each moment exactly how it is, fostering presence and awareness.

In this practice we allow thoughts, emotions, and all other stimuli to surface. We become a witness of these, cultivating a space of non-attachment and revealing a deeper connection with one's inner self.

Newcomers to meditation and long-time practitioners are welcome to attend. This is a FREE practice. There is a suggested donation, but that is not required to attend.
results.how_to_find_us: Once up the stairs, turn around to your left, and go in the door that is mostly glass panes
results.name: Mindfulness Meditation

results.description:
“Tuesdays with Teachers” is a free program we offer to give you the opportunity to learn from our CAPP Teachers and experience Positive Psychology in action. Learn the research science and see how it has the potential to transform people’s lives. 


Join Louis Alloro, and learn How to Avoid Failing: The Science of Setting & Meeting Goals

When: Tues., Jan 5th at 8pm EST 

Where: Online 

What: Incredibly cool people gathering to learn about PP & Resilience

REGISTER NOW!

Research shows that 80% of goals that are set are not met. Why?  Because people confuse goal meeting with goal setting.

People set goals that they don’t meet and judge themselves as lacking in motivation, willpower or follow through when that’s simply not the case.

What they miss is that the goal that they set was faulty and that their process was half backed.

Join us as we explore what research in positive psychology and neuroscience identifies as the most effective processes for meeting your goals and following through on your resolutions. Go beyond the outdated SMART Goals, debunk myths people subscribe to about goals and experience what sets positive psychology apart from pop psychology: scientifically proven tools.  

P.S. Everything you’ll learn in this workshop is just a fraction of the proven and powerful tools that we offer our students who do our 6 month Certificate in Applied Positive Psychology. We’ll give you more information about it at the MeetUp if it’s of interest to you.
results.name: Tuesdays with Teachers is Back!: The Science of Goal Setting

results.description:
If you study the most successful people in the real estate business, they all have one thing in common: they dominate a specific market niche. Whether that niche is high end new construction homes, REOs, short sales, etc. the basics of how to do it are the same.

In this week's marketing meeting we will be discussing:

1. Why choosing a niche is critical
2. How to determine what niche you should target
3. Creating a value proposition for that niche
4. Creating marketing collateral for that niche

5. Tips and tricks to being the expert in a specific category
results.name: How To Dominate A Niche Market

results.description:
We need to get the following information into the hands of EVERY DIRECTOR of a KILL SHELTER in the US as well as BOARD MEMBERS and supporters of those shelters.   Due to a generous grant from a supporter, the NO KILL ADVOCACY CENTER (not to be confused w/organizations with similar names) is making the following offer. We need YOUR HELP! Please post to the Facebook page of EVERY KILL "Shelter" you can think of- as well as every pro-animal group.  Please also email info to shelter directors & board members of Kill "shelters" (contact info below).   Please make it clear that you are NOT a member of any group but are writing as a private citizen.   IMPORTANT:  Always be extremely polite & assume they will stop the killing once they understand how it can be done.

We CAN SEE a NO KILL AMERICA in our lifetimes!
---

FREE to a GOOD (or bad) SHELTER

Are you a SHELTER DIRECTOR? Attorney Nathan Winograd, former Director of Operations for the SF SPCA and Director of the No Kill Advocacy Center, would like to show you- FREE - how ANY SHELTER can become NO KILL - while TURNING A HEFTY PROFIT! For your FREE COPY of the book "REDEMPTION- the No Kill Revolution in America" as well as a your FREE CD with over 200 documents, including “how to” guides, sample policies and procedures that will guide you, step by step, in implementing this proven model, please send a letter on official letterhead to:

No Kill Advocacy Center
6114 La Salle Ave. #837
Oakland CA 94611

The fine print: No emails. U.S. addresses only. Only one per shelter. Under the terms of the grant, this offer does not apply to foster-based rescue groups. While supplies last. For a schedule of screenings of documentary film REDEMPTION: The No Kill Revolution in America (based on the book), please go to www.nokill.org

Note:  (copied from original discussion on August's "virtual event"): a list of the 10 highest kill shelters is available here:   http://www.advocateforsavingdogs.org/highkillshelterslist.html

I posted on lots of sites and wrote the director of a shelter in Augusta, GA - will continue on down the list. I think it might be good strategy, though, to start with the shelters in your town and then state. You go to webpages to find staff members and mail them. I would cc several people at a shelter- my logic being that maybe *one* will be receptive. We can also email members on the boards of directors

PLEASE:  remember to be extremely polite, and always assume the directors are just not aware of the no-kill model and would certainly implement it if they knew how.

IMPORTANT:  Please make it clear that you are writing as a private citizen, and not as part of an organized effort

For more discussion on which states have been covered, etc, please see original discussion at august's virtual "save lives" event.

WE CAN DO THIS!
results.name: SAVE LIVES!

results.description:
Do you VEGETABLE-TARIANS want all the OTHER people (even if they have not committed to be vegetarians) to eat fresh produce?  Then help us - each Wednesday late afternoon - bag vegetables (and some fruit) for the neighbors in Mission Hill.  Usually there are also freshly-baked loaves of bread, also (baked that morning - Jessica's Bakery).

It's an assembly line, then take home a bag (or two) of produce for yourself. 

Bring your business cards, smartphone, or notepad, and prepare to exchange contact info with other volunteers you like.  Volunteers come from several sources (not merely this meetup or others:Craigslist, Pharmacy School, School of Public Health, etc.) 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
VOLUNTEERING for $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill
Tobin Community Center
1481 Tremont Street - inside the front entrance
Mission Hill, Roxbury
(between Brigham Circle and Roxbury Crossing T stops)
Boston, MA 02120 - <2 blocks from Orange Line T Each Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm (indoors in bad weather)


We will be VOLUNTEERING for the weekly Wednesday late afternoon $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill.

When you volunteer,
YOU will ALSO TAKE HOME one or two of those "$2 bags"! 
We've had 55 volunteers, and we've had 7.  Workloads vary!

Fair Foods provides a 20-22 bag of produce for the Mission Hill neighbors so they can eat like me - on produce. The neighbors only need to pay' $2 for the bag.

Volunteers unload the truck, set up 3 banquet tables, set up the food in order of desntiy (heavy food, such as potatoes or onions, on the bottom - lighter, more perishable foods, such as tomatoes and bananas and berries and kale on top), then fill each bag (and 'stack' them upright by one another - for the 'paying neighbors' to pick up (for $2).

Some arrive as early as 3:30 pm (you don't NEED to do that, but you're welcome to do so; OUR meetup's attendees - it's posted on 6 meetups - are often there early, and you can chat).

We (MOST of us) arrive around 4 pm (maybe as late as 4:30 pm) and work until 6 pm (can leave as early as 5:30 pm if we've finished).

In the FRONT of the Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street (between the Brigham Circle T stop - GREEN E-Line - and the Roxbury Crossing Orange Line T stop), behind the wrought iron fence.

Wear comfortable clothing that allows you to move flexibly and to actually work, lifting heavy bags of food. 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Tobin Community Center 
1481 Tremont Street, Boston, MA

THERE IS NO PARKING - IT'S BEST FOR THOSE WHO LIVE IN BOSTON AND TRAVEL IN ON THE MBTA

THERE IS NO PARKING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD

Every Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Bring friends!  Forward the invitation to others!

Invite FRIENDS through the Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter 'share' 
buttons
http://www.yelp.com/events/boston-volunteering-for-2-bag-of-produce-in-mission-hill-each-wednesday-afternoon-from-4-6-pm-at-tobin-community-center

LOGISTICAL CHALLENGE IS TO GET LOW COST VEGETABLES to the REFRIGERATORS of LOCAL RESIDENTS !!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Vegan Cooking classes or Vegan Cooking Ideas 

Vegan Cooking Classes or 
                 Learning How to Prepare Vegan Food

results.description:
Who should join: Beginners to Advanced speakers interested in learning how to improve their public speaking for fun or professionally.  Reduce your fear and increase your confidence.


Why  members should join: Learn the basics of public speaking, challenge your current skills to be a professional speaker or just to have fun & meet interesting people.  You will also be challenged to give more challenging types of speeches such as ice breakers, humorous and inspirational speeches.

What members can expect out of the group: We have a fast paced 1 hour meeting packed with 2 prepared speeches from members as well as Table Topics where anyone is invited to speak on a suggested topic for 1-2 minutes to hone their ability to speak off the cuff.


You can also join our mentorship program and be assigned an advanced speaker who will guide you to improving your skills.

Lead meetings and presentations at work, begin your path to being a better teacher or professional paid public speaker or simply be a better storyteller.

Tuesday 12pm meeting for members and guests. Please visit for free! 

All are welcome.

Synopsis:

Inspired by true events, THE REVENANT is an immersive and visceral cinematic experience capturing one man’s epic adventure of survival and the extraordinary power of the human spirit. In an expedition of the uncharted American wilderness, legendary explorer Hugh Glass (Leonardo DiCaprio) is brutally attacked by a bear and left for dead by members of his own hunting team. In a quest to survive, Glass endures unimaginable grief as well as the betrayal of his confidant John Fitzgerald (Tom Hardy). Guided by sheer will and the love of his family, Glass must navigate a vicious winter in a relentless pursuit to live and find redemption. THE REVENANT is directed and co-written by renowned filmmaker, Academy Award® winner Alejandro G. Iñárritu (Birdman, Babel).

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

A number of folks living NORTH of Boston have asked about an ASL SOCIAL. Let's make this happen!

On WEDNESDAYS, starting October 29 - 6pm to 8pm - I / we will be at the NORTH SHORE MALL Food Court.

While technology has improved the way people communicate, "Deaf Social Clubs" are slowly disappearing. This is a way to start bringing REAL social interaction back!

Please join us for a casual, relaxed, no-pressure two-hour Social, where we can chat, tell stories, get to know each other, and meet new people (or old friends!). Friends, Fun and Food!

A warm welcome is extended to all Deaf & non-Deaf people: folks in the Deaf Community, CODA's, Interpreters, ASL students, parents of deaf children AND their children, ASL professors/teachers, Relay Operators, Deaf services workers- EVERYONE!

This will be a "SOME ASL KNOWLEDGE and ABOVE" Social, because not all of us are ASL-fluent! "Voices- Off" -- we'll all laugh & learn WITH and FROM each other!

WHAT: ASL SOCIAL CLUB
WHERE: North Shore Mall Food Court, PEABODY,MA
DAY/TIME: Wednesdays, 6pm - 8pm
WHY: To meet like-minded people, socialize using ASL, tell stories, and have good time!
WHO: Anyone who wants to chat using American Sign Language!
HOW TO FIND US:  We'll be sitting on the couches closest to the "walkway" side of the Food Court, not hidden inside the food court, so easier to locate us!

If you have any question, please contact Connie or Paul I., through the EMAIL LINK via BOSTON ASL profile page.

PLEASE, if you would be good enough, RSVP either "YES" or "NO" so I know who to look for!

CHEERS!

Connie Cassidy / Paul I.

PEACE...
results.why: ASL is the third largest "foreign language" in the U.S.; ASL is fun to use; ASL is NOT English, but does "borrow" from the English language.

results.description:
Dear Boston Culture Lovers,


The French Cultural Center is hosting an art exhibit opening, ARCHEMY in Talloires. 

The official event starts at 6:30 pm, however the start time for this Meet-up group event is set for 6:00 pm in the reading room.  The exhibit and reception will be presented in the adjacent gallery room.  The plan is to gather and meet-up in the reading room and then go to the exhibit 6:30 pm. 


Complimentary French wine will be served at the opening reception.


Please only reserve "YES" if you are definitely attending and plan to meet members of the group.  If you reserve "YES" and have a change of plans, please update the attendance reservation.

I am looking forward to enjoying this event with the group.

Joana

*** Event Details ***

Event Description


This exhibition presents chemistry-based abstract art pieces that artist and scientist Daniel Jay developed during a residency at the Tufts University Center for European Studies in Talloires, France in Spring 2015. Daniel Jay used dyes, chemicals and chemical reactions to create art works inspired by the life and science of Claude-Louis Berthollet, one of the greatest French chemists, born in Talloires in 1748.

Colleague of Lavoisier, friend and advisor to Napoleon, Berthollet contributed to both theoretical and practical chemistry. He developed the concept of chemical equilibrium and established the nomenclature for chemical compounds that we still use today. He served as director of dye manufacture at the Gobelins tapestry factory, where his work helped to make some of the most beautiful tapestries of their time.

For this exhibition, Jay drew from Berthollet’s science using dyes from his era such as Indigo, Cochineal, Madder and Turmeric and chemicals such as copper sulfate, alum, tin oxide and liquid bleach (which he invented) that he used for textile and tapestry manufacture.  


About Daniel Jay
Daniel Jay has had parallel careers in science (as a professor at Harvard and now Tufts University) and in art for the past 30 years. In the mid-1980s, he was elected a junior fellow of the Harvard Society of Fellows to do both science and art and was provided with both a laboratory and an art studio there. Recently, he began combining his two passions by developing a series of art influenced by science. Titled ARCHEMY in Talloires, this current art uses chemicals and chemical reactions to make novel marks on paper to express how science inspired him throughout his life. 

Directions and Parking Information


Getting here via public transportation (MBTA) Green Line

Get off at Arlington station. Walk north along Arlington Street toward the Charles River. Turn left onto the third street, Marlborough Street. The Center is at the end of the block, at the opposite corner on the right.

Via the Orange Line or Commuter Rail

Get off either train at Back Bay Station. Walk north along Clarendon Street toward the Charles River. Turn right onto the fifth street, Marlborough Street. The Center is at the end of the block, on the left corner.

Parking

Parking is available at the Boston Common Parking Garage (located at Zero Charles St, below the Boston Common Park) on Saturdays all day and on week days after 4pm for $10. Buy your discounted ticket with our receptionist.

http://www.frenchculturalcenter.org/index.cfm/about-us/directions-hours/

results.description:
We will be playing at Tasty Burger, they have great food at a great price. (everyone is responsible for keeping up, asking and paying for their own bill).  There is a (free) pool table along with two arcade games downstairs along with the bar. We will be meeting downstairs behind the pool table. 

All are welcome to attend.  Feel free to bring games, we are open to learning new and FUN games. Or you can just come and watch while talking and making friends. I ask that everyone that comes brings a friendly competition with the realization that we are here to have fun. You may also bring friends along. 

We will have a wide variety of games making it easy to pick something that is more your speed. If you are unfamiliar with them you are always welcome to watch or we would be happy to teach you a new game. It is fairly common for more than one person to be learning a new game at a time, and we love to teach! 

If you are shy and or this is your first meetup this is the best way to break the ice and make some new friends. So come on out and lets play! 

Standard Card Games: 
I will have a few print out on how to play games with regular cards like; Spades, Jim Rummy, Blackjack (21), Speed, War,  Slap Jack, and more. 

How to find us: 
Once you enter Tasty Burger turn left immediately. Walk staright and you will see a red bull head on the right wall. There are stairs that go down. We will be at the booths. 

Keeping it fun: 
Anyone found yelling at another will not be allowed to continue to join in on the fun. 

Parking: 
Street parking is available on surrounding streets in Harvard Square. One and two hour meters require payment (quarters only).
results.how_to_find_us: We will be meeting downstairs.

results.description:
Greetings BUG!  

Before 2015 is even out, we’re looking forward to ushering in the new year with a feast of Lightning Talks!  We’ll have a handful of 10 minute talks, covering the gamut of Unity and Unity-related topics, at Akamai on January 6th, 2016.  

Want to share a snippet of what you’re working on these days, or some tips and tricks?  Using a tool you can’t imagine your fellow Unity devs living without?  Always thought “I should talk at BUG!” but find terror in a full headline talk?

Submit a lightning talk!
(http://goo.gl/forms/5Oph2EFXFn)

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

The Talks:
-Action Lists: Simple, Flexible, Expandable AI - Jesse Crafts-Finch
-Postmortem of Frigate!, A Museum Exhibit - Andy Hall
-UV's: The Good, The Bad and The Ugly - Elliott Mitchell
-PBR Texturing Workflow - Jarien Sky
-Art Style of Desolus - Mark Mayers

-Using the Mechanim System to Animate uGui - Trevor Stricker
-StrangeIOC: Unity Dependency Injection Library - Jeff Campbell

-Using 3D Scanned Assets in VR/AR - Mike Festa

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

January 6th, 2016

Akamai
150 Broadway

results.description:
Are you separated, divorced, considering divorce, or in the process of divorce?

You are invited to a Divorce Open House Mix & Mingle. Please join us for an evening hosted by our divorce professionals in the fields of law, real estate, parenting, finances, nutrition, relationship coaching, career coaching, therapy, accounting, interior design and more. You will have a chance to socialize and speak individually with our divorce professionals in a friendly and casual setting with complimentary drinks and appetizers.

As a group of experienced professionals, we understand the complexities of divorce and separation and the need for a holistic approach to make the process smoother for everyone. We provide important resources that can help to educate and empower you throughout the process. This evening is intended to provide one-on-one interactions in an informal environment with experts in various fields at no cost. Bring your curiosity, questions, or concerns! 

This is a joint event with other meetup groups. There is no charge for attendance, and discussions with professionals are kept confidential. The event starts at 6:30 p.m., but feel welcome to come anytime between 6:30 and 8:30 p.m. You will be able to go in and out at your convenience. 

Complimentary light bites, wine and other refreshments will be provided for your enjoyment throughout the event.
results.how_to_find_us: This is an office building. Park in the parking garage (enter from the left side of the building) and take the elevator up to the 1st floor. The cafe will be on your left. Call or text Deanna at 508-333-3191 with questions or for directions.
results.name: First Wednesdays: Divorce Open House Mix & Mingle

results.description:
Come work on Python projects, get programming help, help others, and hang out. Sponsored by Cens.io.


Python project nights are unstructured chances for Python developers to work together, mentor each other, connect socially, teach, learn, or do whatever else it is Python developers want to do together.

Our project nights are great ways to build the Python community, by allowing them to meet and interact in whatever way they find most beneficial.

Food: Pizza will be provided.

Things to bring: a wireless-enabled laptop and power cord.

Need some project ideas? How about:

Learning Python

• The official Python tutorial

• How to Think Like a Computer Scientist: Learning with Python

• An introduction to Python through writing games

• Learn Python the Hard Way

Projects and competitions

• Puzzles!

• Contribute to an open-source project that uses Python. Developers from OpenHatch, Twisted, and other projects are often here. If you contribute to an open source project that uses Python and want to help new contributors, let us know in a comment!

• Want to learn a Python web framework? Check out the Django tutorial.

results.description:
Come join us for a midweek climb!


All levels are welcome! If you are new to climbing, there is a belay class at 7 PM. Here is the link to sign up: www.centralrockgym.com/bookeo.php?s=watertown 

I will happily belay those who have not climbed before up until 7 PM, but then it's really important to know how to belay and to take the belay test that starts at 7 PM. You can rejoin the group after taking the belay test.

For those of you who already know how to belay, no need to take the class, you just need to pass this gym's belay test when you arrive.

The price is as follows:

Membership: $89/month

Adult Day Pass: $22 

Gear (shoes, harness, belay device): $8 ($5 for members)

Belay class: $15 (free for members)

Belay test: Free

We will meet at the cluster of cubbies on the first floor at 6:30 PM, greet each other, make sure everyone has a group or person to climb with then head off to climb. I'm looking into whether there is a place nearby to grab a bite or drink at the end of the night. If you have a place in mind, please let me know.

I'll send a message letting you know what color shirt and pants I am wearing incase you arrive late and want to search for us. I will also swing by the cubbies every 15 minutes until everyone who signed up has arrived. So, if you are not able to make it or are running late, PLEASE COMMUNICATE on this event's chat or by contacting my cell-phone, which I will send out once you are confirmed for the event.

Hope you can make it! I'm looking forward to meeting more climbers in the area.

~Avery~
results.how_to_find_us: Will meet at 6:30 PM at the cubbies by the stairs
results.name: Climbing at Central Rock (Watertown)

results.description:
Are you separated, divorced, considering divorce, or in the process of divorce?

You are invited to a Divorce Open House Mix & Mingle. Please join us for an evening hosted by our divorce professionals in the fields of law, real estate, parenting, finances, nutrition, relationship coaching, career coaching, therapy, accounting, interior design and more. You will have a chance to socialize and speak individually with our divorce professionals in a friendly and casual setting with complimentary drinks and appetizers.

As a group of experienced professionals, we understand the complexities of divorce and separation and the need for a holistic approach to make the process smoother for everyone. We provide important resources that can help to educate and empower you throughout the process. This evening is intended to provide one-on-one interactions in an informal environment with experts in various fields at no cost. Bring your curiosity, questions, or concerns! 

This is a joint event with other meetup groups. There is no charge for attendance, and discussions with professionals are kept confidential. The event starts at 6:30 p.m., but feel welcome to come anytime between 6:30 and 8:30 p.m. You will be able to go in and out at your convenience. 

Complimentary light bites, wine and other refreshments will be provided for your enjoyment throughout the event.
results.how_to_find_us: This is an office building. Park in the parking garage (enter from the left side of the building) and take the elevator up to the 1st floor. The cafe will be on your left. Call or text Deanna at 508-333-3191 with questions or for directions.
results.name: First Wednesdays: Divorce Open House Mix & Mingle

results.description:
Come join David and friends for a night of Magic: The Gathering over at Not Your Average Joe's in Medford. This event is part of our "Wednesday Night Magic" series.

It doesn't matter if you are an expert "planeswalker", or don't know anything about Magic: The Gathering -- you can come to play or learn this amazing strategy game.  There are usually between 6-12 people at each event, consisting of all experience levels.  All decks of all types are welcome for this "casual play" event.  Beginners who want to learn are welcome!

This location is easily accessible from Rt. 16, Rt. 28 and Rt. 93, and is walking distance from the T, near the new Station Landing apartment complex. Here is a map of the area.

By Subway: Take the Orange Line to Wellington. Walk over the skybridge and cross through the parking lot. Upon exiting the garage, you'll see a building complex (SL75) across the street. Cross the street and take a right. Follow around this building and you'll find Not Your Average Joe's on the opposite side of the street.

By Car: If you are driving, be aware that Station Landing is at the intersection of Rt. 16 and Rt. 28, and you can enter the Station Landing complex from the north-bound side of Rt. 28, or the east-bound side of Rt. 16. There are a number of stores in the Station Landing complex -- look for the Margarita's, Starbucks or Not Your Average Joe's signs. NYAJ is located right off of Rte. 28. Although there is free parking all around the building, we recommend that MTG Boston members park in the garage underneath the restaurant.
results.name: Wednesday Magic In Medford

results.description:
Let's turn "Thinking Into Results" and get real.   You will leave a different person, I guarantee it.   Let's take a look at what it is you really want, not what others thinks you want,  but what YOU really ... want.  


I am looking forward to meeting everyone , please contact me with questions.  

First Floor Conference Room: Adams/Attucks(not ground  floor)


Michele 

Parking and details are below. 

I am so grateful now that we found the perfect space for us.   It is a room with a view of the Charles River and Boston Skyline. (see photo's attached) This was taken from our conference room window (for location purposes) 

It will a fun and productive workshop.  Paper, pens and water will be available.  

Please bring your ID and sign in at the front lobby. All MIT buildings have security. Please let me know if you have questions.  

Directions: 

Parking: (4 options)

1. Street Parking: right in front of building

2. Meter Parking: around back side perimeter of building

3. There are 2-3 parking lots (behind building) used for business during the  day. Park at your own risk. 

4. Drive about 10 yards from front door and take a right into driveway (see photo below) Parking lot under building: $10.00 USD 

On the T:


Take the Red Line to the Kendall/MIT stop.Walk straight up Main Street toward the Longfellow Bridge (past the Post Office, Bank of America).You will see the Parking Garage on your right, Take a right and you can enter the building from the side. Approximately a 5 minute walk.

Driving:  

1 Memorial Drive side of Charles River: right next Longfellow Bridge: (AKA:  Salt and Pepper Bridge)  Nerd Center is on the corner (construction near by). 

GPS address: 1 Memorial Drive Cambridge, MA (not to far from Museum of Science) 

Weather:

Will continue unless heavy snow storm.  See meetup for any cancellation. 

There is no snow date but we will reschedule for February.  Pleas bring ID to sign in at front desk. 

Front door view standing one memorial drive: (parking lot on left on photo)
results.name: Worthy Goals: 2016  Turn "Thinking Into Results"   Workshop

results.description:
Want to learn Public Speaking but not sure where to start?

Are you afraid of speaking in front of groups?

Use filler words like 'um', 'and', 'like', 'you know'?

Have no idea how to structure an interesting speech?

Then this is the place for you.

EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING

Our hands on class will give you a safe, supportive and fun atmosphere to practice public speaking with other beginners  who are also your supportive audience.

PERSONALIZED COACHING

When you sign up I'll ask you 1-2 specific goals you want to learn in class and I'll teach it to you!

It's a customized syllabus designed by you.

Not sure where to start? No worries, I'll teach you the beginning steps.

CREATE CONFIDENCE

Fear of speaking in front of a group?

Not to worry...you'll learn the coping mechanisms the professionals use and the fear will turn to excitement!


VIDEO FEEDBACK

Optional video taping of your speech is available so you can see yourself and make your own evaluation.

We upload your practice speeches to Dropbox and only the class students can see it later.

We can also video tape with just your smartphone for super privacy.

It's a powerful tool to evaluate yourself.


OTHER BENEFITS

Learn how to give a speech without notes and never forget what to say!

How about getting rid of those pesky 'ums', 'likes', 'you knows' and other filler words?  That's part of the class.

Have a specific project or presentation? Practice it in this class.

Let the President of Toastmasters Boston Copley share with you the basics of solid speech making.

Our small classes are designed to give you the individual attention, feedback and suggestions to help you thrive!

MONEY BACK GUARANTEE

If you feel it's not worth your money you get a 100% refund.  No questions asked.

See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Clarendon/Boylston Entrance. Annex building attached to church.   Ask front desk attendant for room location or look at sign posted at entrance.  Text/call Michael 617-470-3086 if you need more help.  See you soon!
results.name: Beginner Public Speaking Academy CUSTOM COACHING + PRACTICE + VIDEO FEEDBACK

From Mugford Street from Old Town:At the bottom of the hill bear right onto a very small section of Green Street.Take the immediate right onto Pond Street.Take the second left onto Farrell Court.At the top of the hill look to the right to the brick building with the fire escape. Enter from the fire escape and take the second door into the Community Room.
From Elm Street: Pass the old Story School on right, Curtis and Creesey Streets on the left.Take the next left onto a very small section of Green Street.Take immediate right onto Pond Street. Follow as above.
From West Shore Drive:Take a right onto Green Street, bear right onto Creesey Street.At the intersection with Elm Street, go left.Take the immediate left onto a very small section of Green Street.Take immediate right onto Pond StreetFollow as above. 
Parking:All parking spaces in the lot are assigned.  Park on Pond Street and walk in or park along the curbs on Farrell Court.  Parking is also available along the playing field on Lime Street, which is the first left off Pond.

results.description:
To have an abundance of something is to have more than you need. It's often used to describe positive qualities, such as "an abundance of love."

Spiritual abundance...is shown by an authentic, omnipresent gratitude for the divinity in all things. This is typically truth for those who have awakened spiritually to unity consciousness. To feel spiritually abundant, exudes a deep gratitude for the moment, for breath, for existence, for experience. Those who have truly touched unity consciousness see the divine in all things. When you are blessed enough to see the divine in all things, you can connect to the flow of all life.  Everything is divinely given. Everything is an opportunity to BE. We want for nothing, because we embody the knowing that we already have everything. Our true nature expands through the entire universe; through and beyond all things. We become both everything and nothing. You can only really know this once unity consciousness has been fully embodied and you've expanded into presence. When we see the divine in all things, we might not have two pennies to rub together; we might lack a home or a family. Yet we are filled with the very divine energy that we see in all things. We are truly abundant!

This guided meditation will assist you to simply be in the moment, an opportunity to become everything and nothing at the same time, to expand your consciousness to embody more fully your divinity.

Nicol will be leading this meditation group.  Nicol has been practicing and teaching for over 15 years.  Meditating within a group has profound healing effects and many experience a deeper sense of being as they are supported by the energy of the group!

Energy exchange $10 at the door. 

Doors open at 6:45pm with the group beginning at 7pm!  Please call the office if you are running late or having trouble getting into the building.  Note the building doors lock in the evening so you will need to buzz up to get in (instructions are to the right of the front door).  Phones are shut off at the start of the group!

www.essencehealing.net  www.nicoljackson.com
results.name: Meditation for Spiritual Abundance!

results.description: "I appeal to you, brothers, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that all of you agree, and that there be no divisions among you, but that you be united in the same mind and the same judgment."  Perhaps one of the most troubled churches we see in the New Testament while also being one of the most blessed, Corinth is an example of God's grace not to give up on a struggling church, as well as an example of how to be the church God wants.  1 (and 2!) Corinthians, Paul's back-to-back letters to the saints in Corinth, provide great insight into unity, maturity, church growth, humility, love, the resurrection, church discipline, salvation, faith, and a number of essential topics for those seeking God.  Come join us in our study of 1 Corinthians!
results.how_to_find_us: We're meeting on the second floor in the Kuumba Library.  Enter the main entrance on Clarendon Street, take the spiral staircase to the right, and we're in the room to the right.  See you there!
results.name: Study 1 Corinthians

results.description:
Welcome to the weekly BKBS Wednesday meet up. Please join us at 7:00 PM by the 3rd table station in the middle of the top roping / lead area. If you are still by the bouldering wall, keep on walking.

We usually meet there for about 10 mins, and then team up in groups of 2 or 3 for top-rope climbing.

If you know that you'll be late, let us know in the comments section, and maybe tell us what you'll be wearing, so we can look out for you. 

BKBS (http://www.bkbsomerville.com/Classes/. If you have a working knowledge of how to belay, you will need to be belay certified before climbing on the ropes. Please flag down a BKBS employee and let them know you need to take a belay test. To pass such a test you will need to display how to tie a double figure eight knot with a fisherman's backup, safely belay a climber up a wall, catch them on a fall, and lower them to the ground safely.

What equipment do I need?  You will need at the bare minimum a harness and climbing shoes. Rentals are available. Grigri devices are provided at every station.

What if I can come, but at a different time?  Just let everyone know you want to climb at a different time and use the community to find a partner for those dates / times.

These are the climbing rates:

ADMISSION (Full day use, you can leave and come back!): 

Day Pass - $25 (Students $20) 
10 Pack - $225 (Students $180)

(Membership Pricing also available)

RENTALS: 

Shoes - $5 
Harness - $5 
Chalk Bag - $2 
Full Gear Kit - $11
results.how_to_find_us: The third table in the middle of the climbing area between 7:00-7:10 PM. It's the table in the middle of the TR \/ Lead area.
results.name: Brooklyn Boulders Somerville Wednesday

results.description:
Here's the game plan:

7:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

7:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

7:20 - Play!!!!!!

9:00 - Conclude the meetup and begin socializing


Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a dark or white "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

results.description:
You have probably heard of MOOCs -- Massive Online Open Courses. Learn more about them and about the myriad other sources of free or low-cost on-line education available with the help of the Internet and/or your local library.

Curiosity is one of the defining characteristics of our humanity. Given the rising costs of higher education and the many demands placed on our time in modern days, it's not practical to rely on traditional sources of learning to satisfy that curiosity throughout a lifetime. The ubiquity of Internet access has given us unprecedented access to a wealth of resources that can help us all become autodidacts, or self-educated persons.

About the speaker:

Maria Greene is part of the steering committee of the Concord Area Humanists. She has a degree in computer science from Brown University and is the founding partner of a Boston-area web development firm. Maria is also the part-time Executive Director of the UU Humanist Association.

General Information

Our First Wednesday Dialog series brings in outside speakers to share interesting topics related to Humanism -- kind of like Ted Talk. We socialize and enjoy refreshments until about 7:15, at which point the speakers presents for as long as they choose, usually until 8:00 or so. At this point we pass the mic around and have a group discussion about the topic. When the discussion wraps up, we continue with more refreshments and socializing until around 9:00 when all attendees are welcome to join our open steering committee meeting.

We  take donations at the door to cover the cost of the meeting ($5 is suggested). Half of the donations (after we pay the rent) are given as an honorarium to the speaker. All regular attendees are encouraged to bring refreshments to share.

Note that we have a large mailing list outside of Meetup.com so the RSVP numbers are generally much lower than the actual attendance.
results.how_to_find_us: The entrance to the Hall is around to the right side if you are facing the Meeting House front doors.
results.name: Maria Greene, "Lifelong Learning for Free Using the Internet", First Wed. Dialog

results.description:
Are you sniffling, sneezing, coughing, aching, stuffy-head, fever, and need some rest? Don’t suppress it, support it! Cold medications suppress your body’s ability to fight back against wintertime viruses – and leave you drudging into work like a zombie. There’s another way – you can learn to give your body the support it needs to get you back on your feet!

Come learn about how to take care of yourself during cold and flu season without resorting to pharmaceuticals. Plants are a much better option for this kind of health care: they work with your body instead of against it, and they change and adapt every year, just as the viruses do, so that you always have the latest flu-fighting agents!

You’ll learn how to stay sickness-free when everyone around you is sneezing, and what to do if your defenses get down and you do get sick. We’ll give you easy recipes for healing with many things you already have in your kitchen or can pick up right at the market.

Join us for this evening lecture on staying healthy through cold and flu season!

http://commonwealthherbs.com/influenza-cold-herb-remedy-class/

Wednesday, January 6th, 2016
7:00pm – 9:00pm
25 St. Mary’s Court, Brookline

results.description:
PLEASE NOTE: In anticipation of the Glass-Chewing Leader of the Cartel's imminent absence due to Family Growth, hosting duties for the regular Wednesday Night Gaming is being handled by a rotating cast of regulars.

Wednesday Night Gaming is our more-or-less weekly free-for-all of strategy gaming goodness downstairs at the Porter Square Panera. There's rarely a set agenda for these events but you are welcome and encouraged to hash out a plan beforehand in comments if you've got something you're dying to play. Nonetheless, you are not required to bring a game to play -- our only requirement is that you bring an open mind!

The event officially begins at 7 PM but people often trickle in early, so you're welcome to sit down to a filler game to get warmed up, or arrange to meet a little early if you've got a group looking to tackle an extra-meaty game.

Please be aware that Panera has been quite gracious about hosting us with minimal fuss -- in order to keep things this way, please respect the hardworking people who work there and, especially, their desire to get out after a long shift.

We'll see you at the gaming table!

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.


Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time. I have very limited access to the internet and that can make it difficult for me to respond to emails. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

These classes are not affiliated with any church or religion.

results.description:
Awaken the Healing Power within Your Body and Mind


·  Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing power

·  Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships

·  Learn to work constructively with your own emotions

·  Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities

·  Develop new resources and capabilities

·  Become clear about your life’s purpose

Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.

Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.

Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses

Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.

Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.

Discover the passion and power that resides within you

Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind

We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.

Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.

Alternate Tuesdays at 7:30 PM at Unity of Somerville, located at 6 William Street at the corner of College Avenue

He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

results.description:
Join the Boston Austrian Economics Group as we embark upon Chapters 11 & 12, of Part III, in the Austrian classic; "Human Action: A Treatise on Economics," by Ludwig von Mises. The group will discuss the weekly readings and questions.

Please note that the readings are not required to attend our meeting, but are recommended. As always, anyone interested in economics is welcome.

Tony C's Sports Bar and Grill has plenty of parking and is accessible via the Orange Line "Assembly" stop.   Our group meets in the private room at the back of the restaurant, the reservation is under Austrian Economics Group.

Please feel free to call Natalya @[masked], with any questions.

READINGS:

PART III


CHAPTER 11: VALUATION WITHOUT CALCULATION
CHAPTER 12: THE SPHERE OF ECONOMIC CALCULATION

QUESTIONS:

1) In what way does acting man value means, and what does the act of choice always involve?

2) Why is it necessary to use money prices in order to engage in economic calculation, and why does the economist need to first explain the direct barter economy before analyzing the monetary economy?

3) Does exchange imply that the goods or services involved have equal value, and how is this value measured?

4) What is "Crusoe Economics," and why is this approach problematic?

5) How does money solve the problem of economic calculation?

6) Why do economic calculation and the estimation of the expected outcome of future action go hand in hand?

7) What do financial balance sheets reflect, regarding economic calculation?

8) Why is it nonsensical to compute national income or national wealth?

9) Why is the conception of stabilization useless in a world of perpetual change?

10) Why can't other things remain equal if the purchasing power of money changes?

11) What are the problems with government bonds, and how is the interest for these bonds financed?

12) Is money neutral?


SEE YOU AT THIS WEEK'S AUSTRIAN ECONOMICS MEETING!
results.name: THE VALUATION AND SPHERE OF ECONOMIC CALCULATION

results.description:
Here are just some of the things you can get out of these meetings:

• Access to thousands of dollars of courses, software, and other resources

• Advice on overcoming a business or marketing obstacle you're facing

• Accountability, so you actually get your work done and turn your dreams into reality

• Ideas and inspiration to help you make something new or improve what you already have

• Meet awesome people who enjoy talking about this stuff as much as you do

Or, you can be a fly on the wall.  No pressure at all.  Feel free to drop in to just listen and see what internet marketing really looks like from people who are actually doing it.

These meetings tend to run between 1.5-2 hours.  Here's the way it works:

7:00pm Join the meeting here:  https://hangouts.google.com/call/dq4qhhdefftaq3fmqwij2ipe2ea.  It tends to work best with Chrome (rather than Internet Explorer or FireFox).

First, new members introduce themselves, and existing members talk about what goals they hit and didn't hit in the past week.  This part usually takes about 15 minutes.  The remainder of our time is spent helping one of our members overcome any problems they may be facing by giving them a chance to sit on the "Couch of Insight!"  Long story short, with our dozens of years of experience and our huge diversity of current business projects, we give them brutal but constructive feedback on their plans and current projects, helping them get insights they could never get from their friends and family alone.

Anyone can join.  It doesn't matter where you are, how older you are, or even what stage of your business you're in.  Our regular members include everyone from total beginners who are just getting their feet wet all the way up to serial entrepreneurs who are already making six-figures or more in their spare time doing this stuff.

results.description:
Ellen Jaffe JonesThe Veg Coach

Creative Cook / Author / Consultant
From our test kitchen to your home kitchen

OK, show of hands.  How many of you eat quinoa as a side dish?
Most cooks use the protein-rich grain as a substitute for rice.
But, I've got a treat for you today.  It's a recipe for Quinoa crisp chocolate balls!
What a way to reward yourself for following a healthy lifestyle.

Find it below.

Consider this too as a tasty approach to getting people interested in coming to one of my FREE cooking classes. This week, Wednesday at 9pm EST, I'll be doing a free class prepping and serving 2 recipes from my book "Eat Vegan on $4 a Day." Bring any questions to our Google Hangout: 

https://plus.google.com/events/c0oegddjuh07utbrq1mv6vm1rfg

Happy cooking,

Ellen Jaffe Jones
The Veg Coach
http://www.vegcoach.com

Buy my books:

Paleo Vegan

Eat Vegan on $4 a Day

Kitchen Divided - Vegan Recipes for Semi-Vegan Households

This is a Quinoa crisp chocolate bar you might find at your local health food store.  
But, my recipe lets you create your own Quinoa chocolate treat.  

It'll satisfy your chocolate cravings and it's so easy to make.  

The recipe is below.

You're Going to Love This!  

Quinoa Crisp Chocolate Treats
by Ellen Jaffe Jones

INGREDIENTS 

1 cup vegan chocolate chips
1/2 cup puffed quinoa
4 teaspoons coconut oil
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional)

PREPARATION INSTRUCTIONS

1 cup vegan chocolate chips
1/2 cup puffed quinoa
4 teaspoons coconut oil
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional)

Melt chocolate chips in a double-boiler, or place in a microwave-safe bowl and heat for about 60 seconds until the chips develop a slight sheen.  
Place all ingredients in a medium pot (or add to the double-boiler) and over medium heat, and stir constantly for about 5 minutes taking care not to burn the chocolate. 
Form small balls and place on a non-stick cookie sheet.  
Refrigerate for at least 60 minutes before serving.  
For those wanting to reduce fat intake, this can be made without the coconut oil, but make sure the chocolate chips are completely melted.   

Buy The Books

Follow on Instagram

results.description:
Organizer: Steve Blum[masked]


=========================

Read the entire description before you RSVP and answer all of the questions that are part of the RSVP process. Failure to answer them will result in your removal from this event. Sometimes the questions won't show up if you use a phone or tablet to RSVP so use a computer. 

If you underestimate the demands of this event; overestimate your experience, knowledge, skills or abilities; or come unprepared you put yourself as well as others at risk so consider this before you decide to participate. Contact me if you have any questions. 

=========================

What We're Doing...

This is a lasts minute plan to climb Mt. Moriah, one of the NH 4,000 Footers.


We will climb to the summit from the Stony Brook Trailhead, via the Stony Brook and Carter-Moriah Trails. We will return to our vehicles backtracking the on the same trails.


Since you are ultimately responsible for your own safety you will need to become self-reliant by learning about the route and potential hazards. Use this link for more information about the summits and trails:

•http://trailsnh.com/peaks/nh/4000/41-Mt-Moriah-4049</a>


Use this link for the current weather forecast:

• <a href="http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=44.3403&lon=-71.1315#.VowmQFJ2GSo">http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=44.3403&lon=-71.1315#.VowmQFJ2GSo

Guests are not permitted - all participants must be members of the group.


Dogs are permitted - be sure to bring a leash in case you need to use it and a copy of their current rabies vaccination.

Trip Summary...

On this moderate pace (~2.0 MPH) trip we will hike about 10 miles and climb about 3,400feet. It should take an average hiker about 7 hours to complete this trip. This event is considered to be INTERMEDIATE because of the pace, distance, and elevation gain.

We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Our pace will be that of the slowest hiker. This trip isn't for you if you are faster than the group and don't want to stay with us, if you want to head off on your own, or if you are slower than the group and expect us to constantly wait for you.

What to Bring... Bring full winter gear with absolutely NO COTTON.

It is winter in the mountains, despite the previously warm weather and low snowfalls. I don't think we will need snowshoes according to recent trail reports, but we will need SHARP micro traction (Kahtoola Microspikes or Hillsound Trail Crampons.)  Weather appropriate clothing and previous winter experience is required. Be sure to bring headlamps with fresh, spare batteries. Also, plenty of food and liquid.

Use this link for a list of items needed for a winter day hike:

• http://files.meetup.com/492954/Winter_ Day_Hike_List_ADK.pdf

Do not rely on others to have extra items to share with you at the meeting spot or on the trail. You should know how to use all of your equipment - test and adjust it prior to this trip. 

Directions...


We will meet in the parking lot at the trailhead for the Stony Brook Trail which is located on the east side of Route 16, 1.5 miles south of Gorham center. Here are directions that you can customize from your starting point. 

<a href="https://www.google.com/maps/dir/Boston,+MA/Stony+Brook+Trailhead,+White+Mountain+Rd,+Gorham,+NH/@43.3764296,-72.3608847,8z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m13!4m12!1m5!1m1!1s0x89e3652d0d3d311b:0x787cbf240162e8a0!2m2!1d-71.0588801!2d42.3600825!1m5!1m1!1s0x4cb3ed740aa90ea7:0x89fa7e5164d7a168!2m2!1d-71.1778481!2d44.3630451"></a>

https://www.google.com/maps/dir/Boston,+MA/Stony+Brook+Trailhead,+White+Mountain+Rd,+Gorha

While carpooling is encouraged you are responsible for coordinating your own rides. Use the comments section below to communicate with others who may also be looking to share a ride. If you do share a ride be sure to share the expenses (gas and tolls).

Random Group of Hikers Disclaimer...

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hike Safe Responsibility Code; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
results.name: Mt. Moriah NH4K-Very Last Minute: INTERMEDIATE

Working the spine releases the tension in the Central nervous system.  As every organ inside you is being  compressed,and released, your system can flush fresh blood through them cleansing and stimulating them. 

Energetically, twists speed  things up and magnify the effects of your intentions. Stay for the Lunchtime Mindfulness meditation and be present for you life changes.
