Each week, Elaine will lead the group in a guided meditation to induce a deepened state of relaxation, healing on all levels.  You can achieve an expanded state of self and a higher state of consciousness, connecting you to the ALL that IS! 

Elaine is able to connect with the most highest vibrations and frequencies of light that serves the group as a whole.  Your personal experience will be enhanced by the group setting.

results.description:
Meditation practice develops concentration, which allows us to calm and steady the mind and give us clear access to our natural wisdom. This practice is 30 minutes of guided Vipassana meditation followed by a brief discussion.

The focus is to be present in the moment, allowing thoughts and emotions to surface. We become an internal observer of these, fostering healthy non-attachment and cultivating a deeper connection with one's inner self.

Newcomers to meditation and long-time practitioners are welcome to attend.

results.description:
Save the time and date:Thurday, January 7, 2016  12:30pm, somewhere in Arlington.


Remember when you worked in an office,and they gave you some time to eat lunch in the cafeteria, and  you actually pulled yourself away from your desk and went and ate lunch with other people?  

Nah, I don't remember that either, but it sure sounds like fun.  And, it's the law.  If your employer denied you a lunch break, you'd be filing a complaint with the state so fast.  

About 25 people expressed interest, which means that probably five to eight people will show up.  The others will all have good excuses, such as, "It's too cold," "I'm too tired," "I have too much work," "I have a deadline," "my clients need me," etc.  I don't want to hear your excuses, Please don't bore me with those lame-o excuses, I just want you to show up.

RSVP by obtaining a free ticket at eventrbire, first come, first served: 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/thursday-collegial-lunch-for-people-who-work-at-home-in-arlingtonbelmontcambridge-tickets-20069981856


 that way I'll know you're coming, and be able to contact you easily.  That will also help  to limit the attendance. If you think this idea can fly, please do sign up and show up, and then we can repeat this pleasure again next week. bests,

-rsr-

Ron Rothenberg

4Buyers RE

results.description:
Free Movie Screening: Anamolisa – 1/7 Kendall – 7:30pm
Leave a reply Michael Stone, husband, father and respected author of “How May I Help You Help Them?” is a man crippled by the mundanity of his life. On a business trip to Cincinnati, where he’s scheduled to speak at a convention of customer service professionals, he checks into the Fregoli Hotel. There, he is amazed to discover a possible escape from his desperation in the form of an unassuming Akron baked goods sales rep, Lisa, who may or may not be the love of his life. A beautifully tender and absurdly humorous dreamscape, from the brilliant minds of Charlie Kaufman (SYNECDOCHE, NEW YORK) and Duke Johnson (“Community” episode, Abed’s Uncontrollable Christmas), this stop-motion animation wonder features the vocal cast of Jennifer Jason Leigh, Tom Noonan and David Thewlis and a stirring strings-based score by Carter Burwell. The darkly comedic and surreal stop-motion journey of a man’s long night of the soul, ANOMALISA confirms Charlie Kaufman’s place amongst the most important of American filmmakers, and announces Duke Johnson as a major creative force.

https://youtu.be/DT6QJaS2a-U
results.name: Anomalisa  1-7 Thur.   Kendall Sq.  7:30 PM

results.description:
In 2016, our Thursday night workshops will run in six-week blocks, four times in the year.

New members are always welcome. We'll be prepared to discuss work in any genre, prose or verse. Bring enough copies of the text you’d like to discuss for each workshop attendee to have their own. If you do not have the means to make copies, send the text by attachment to bostonpoetryunion (at) gmail (dot) com not later than the night before the workshop.

Occasionally, the moderator will invite a member or guest speaker to open the session with a brief talk on some literary topic. If you’re interested in delivering such a talk, email the organizers and let them know! We are similarly open to suggestions for writing exercises, discussions at members' homes, visits to readings or bookstores, and other events of interest to writers. 

ABOUT THE WORKSHOP: Now in its 14th year, the weekly Boston Poetry workshop (formerly “Charles River Writers”) is an open, accessible, and welcoming forum for literary fellowship and discussion.

Every Thursday

Men, Women, Singles, Couples

Everyone Else Class 7pm-8pm

The Original Steppers of Boston offer Certified Chicago Style Steppin' dance instruction for the new beginner to the seasoned stepper. We also host a supportive environment for steppers to practice and participate in an open dance to hone their dance skills.

results.description:
Every Thursday evening at 6:30 PM we gather as a group for a nice nighttime "romp" at the Chestnut Hill Reservoir. It's a great way to wind down a busy work day, to catch up with Bulldogs friends, or to meet new people!

The Boston Bulldogs is a co-ed non-profit running club founded to support those battling addiction and in recovery, those who have been affected by addiction and their supporters.

We welcome and encourage runners of all levels – dreamers, beginners, as well as those with running experience, past or present. Our volunteer runners will be there to coach you at your current level, and help you meet your goals. We might even be able to help with running gear if needed. 

We meet twice weekly at the Reservoir (Cleveland Circle/Reservoir Green Line C or D train) -- on Saturday mornings at 10:00 am and Thursday evenings at 6:30 pm. We will first gather in front of the Starbucks in Cleveland Circle, before heading over to the reservoir. See you there! 

If you are interested in becoming a member or a volunteer, in making a contribution to the Club, in sponsoring a runner in recovery, or in learning more about the Boston Bulldog educational wellness/running program, contact us at:

• Website - BostonBulldogsRunning.com

• Email - [masked] 

• Phone -[masked]

results.description:
Azure Machine Learning (Azure-ML) is the cloud based machine learning service from Microsoft.

John Pelak, now of Microsoft, will show us how it works.

Also new sponsor, Grape City!  I have a little something for everyone.


John's Bio:
John has over 25 years of experience in the software industry building products and solutions. Most recently, he led the Devices and Mobility team for 5 years at a Boston-based boutique development shop, BlueMetal, where they built high-end user experiences for Windows, iOS, and Android across the spectrum of technologies, devices, and form factors. Prior to that, he spent 13 years at Microsoft in various technical roles, 2 years at the Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center as a software architect, and 5 years at AT&T as a software engineer.


John has pursued academic study of data science and biotechnology. He's nearing completion of the Johns Hopkins Data Science Specialization on Coursera, and have also completed courses on Biological Sequence Analysis, Machine Learning, Human Physiology, and Cellular Mechanisms of Brain Function. Tools like AzureML Studio and the Cortana Analytics Suite will accelerate discovery, and could be part of understanding and eventually curing a wide range of debilitating diseases and conditions.


In his spare time, John enjoys listening to and playing music, and can be enticed to run in road races or various outdoor activities (biking, skiing, etc.) He lives with his wife, his 2 sons, and mother-in-law out in Harvard, MA, and will be enjoying the train rides into and out of Kendall Square daily.
results.name: Azure ML - Machine Learning for All of Us - John Pelak

results.description:
Through discussion, sharing, writing and meditating learn more about mediation and yourself in a safe space. Begin a meditation practice or deepen an existing one. 

Transformation Meditation allows you to explore your higher self or you as the 'Knower'.  With the use of breathing techniques, mantras, you are offered the opportunity to watch feelings, sensations, and thoughts come and go; without judgement.

Benefits of meditation include: reduction in anxiety and fight or flight (freeze) response, reduces depression (increases positive emotion), enhances compassion (benefitting your personal relationships), increase in feeling connected, increases your ability to regulate emotion.

Meditation cushions and blankets provided.  Please bring a notebook or journal (will be available for purchase).

Cost: $75 for 4-week series, paid in advance or $20 per session. We will be meeting 1/7, 1/14, 1/21 & 1/28.  Discount offered to those signing up for an additional meditation series.

Visit www.tlgcounseling.com for more information about meditation, mindfulness, stress reduction and more!

**Group will run regardless of Meetup.com RSVP's**

results.description:
"Are Solar and Wind Energy going to supplant 'dirty fuels'???"

Bruce Vega and Alex Rhalimi will present how energy deregulation is the and what that means for ecologically-informed visions of human life on the planet.

Warren Buffett and Bill Gates each has said that energy deregulation is the biggest transfer of wealth in the history of business, and it's ongoing (from The Motley Fool).

Learn about direct carbon reduction (vs. offsets) and sustainability impacts.


When you arrive, ask to speak with Maynard Clark. Mention that you're from this meetup.  Say specifically that you're there to enjoy the discussion on "Are Solar and Wind Energy going to supplant 'dirty fuels'???"

Thursday evening discussions with community forming.
Discussions and Q&A will follow each presentation.
For some interesting comparisons, bring your utility (light, electricity) bills.

Consider bringing food to share (with plates and utensils).

Hello,

Thank you for visiting this page. Whether you're new to Massachusetts, new to Toastmasters or looking for a different club, this is the place to be. We meet every FIRST & THIRD Thursdays of every month, twice a month.

This is a very friendly supportive, encouraging environment. members come come a variety of cultures and academic & professional background. 

Minutemen Toastmasters Club is a great place to learn to speak in front of the audience, accept constructive feedback, manage your time and network with a diverse culture, that is committed to each other's success.

If you are new, you can attend the club three times to assess if it meets your needs. On the third meeting we suggest you join the club as a member. You are also free to visit other clubs to satisfy your personal needs. 


Please RSVP for all the future meetings!!


Thank you,

~VJ / VP Membership

results.description:
How Do we open up our hearts to find Joy in our life?
Life hits us with obstacles and challenges that keep us from readily accessing Joy.
Do you feel stuck in your life? We get stuck in thought patterns and behaviors in our life that prevent us from creating the life of our dreams. To move forward we must re-purpose what is holding us back and develop new ways to approach life by redefining our underlying beliefs.This is deeply transformational work that will elevate your personal experience of life, enabling you to have deeper relationships that work, the ability to go with the flow and experience great Joy.

In this series of workshops in a supportive group setting you will explore feelings, aspects of ourselves and ways to balance that control our ability to experience more Joy. Each workshop we will work with our own personal healing through the use of visualization and high vibrational essential oils to help us move through our personal growth.

Fee for this workshop is $30.00

results.description: Come check out dragon boating with Living Root! We're a co-ed dragon boat team and we're always looking for new paddlers to join us. This is a great way to get in shape, stay in shape, meet people, and do something fun and competitive. How to get there: We practice at the pool at the JFK Elementary School in Somerville. Walk through the outdoor basketball courts to the rear of the building to find the pool entrance. Take the stairs down to the ground floor and head through the locker rooms to get to the pool. Practice will begin poolside at 7 pm. Wear athletic clothing. Although we won't do any swimming, you will get somewhat wet. Parking is free in the school parking lot. The T station at Porter Square is a 5 minute walk away. Practice will last an hour and 45 minutes. We provide paddles and all the necessary equipment--just bring yourself! No paddling experience is required. We have an excellent coaching staff who will teach you everything you will need to know. We often head out for a quick bite to eat after practice, and you're welcome to join us. Send questions to: Dave Parker at [masked] [url=http://www.livingroot.org/]www.livingroot.org[/url]

results.description:
Cambridge meetup is back! We are going to have this event every other week!


http://www.championscambridge.com/


As usual, please bring your driver's license or passport, if you would like to have alcohol. They are strict about IDs, No IDs no booze.  But people under 21 are welcome as well to this event  - Champions is almost as much a restaurant as a bar and you need not order a drink.


You are responsible for your own consumption and please start and settle your own tab. Please bring your Credit/Debit card or cash and start your tab with the waiter.    Please be sure to tip - we suggest 20% as it is a lot of extra trouble for them to do separate tabs, but it saves us work and allows people to leave at different times.  But first be sure that the tip is not included already - it usually is not but occasionally is, at 18%, if there is a large group, in which case you need not tip additional.  (If you know the price of what you ordered, and add 6.25% MA meals tax, and that is the total, they have NOT added in the tip.)

RSVP required. Please sign up. If you RSVP "Yes," but your plans change, please change your RSVP to "No" so others can sign up. Deadline for reservation is 3PM as we need to get an accurate head count for the reservation. On nights when we are expecting many people, we limit the RSVP number to 27. However, if you'd like to attend, but can't RSVP, send a message to an organizer, as we may be able to get you in.


Champions is located at MIT/Kendall Sq. station. If you come from Boston side, you will see right in front of the T exit. It is part of the Marriott. Even though the address is listed as 50 Broadway, you can really only see it from the Main street side.  We are usually either in the separate room toward the Marriott lobby, or else at two long central tables in the room to the right of the host station.

results.description:
It’s time again for that most magical of seasons: it’s time to watch Die Hard.

That’s right; it’s the perfect time to gather ’round the tree with your loved ones, and—oh! Say, what’s that sound in the air vents? Why, it’s jolly ol’ John McClane! Once a year, he comes out to the coast to get together, have a few laughs, and single-handedly invent the “one-man army” genre of movies, in my opinion, though a case could be made that Steve McQueen invented the role in Bullitt. That was also a good movie.

I have been told that there are other holidays going on this month, also!

Anyway, between all these many holidays and watching all that Die Hard, but not the sequels, except maybe—maybe—Die Hard 2. Like, it had its moments, y’know? It was okay. Still, it was no— Sorry, what was I talking about before?

—Oh, BostonJS. Yeah. Okay—between all these holidays and all this Die Hard, we’ve had to reschedule BostonJS! The next BostonJS will be on Thursday, January 7th. Mark your calendars!

Until then—from all of us here on Team BostonJS to all of you and yours—yippee-ki-yay to all, and to all a good night.
results.name: NOW I HAVE A BOSTONJS HO - HO - HO

results.description:
Deepening into the practice of Speaking Circle turns will support you in continuing  to develop full presence in front of groups.  Being in Relational Presence with your audience is the key.

Relational Presence, the foundation of Speaking Circles, is a precondition for all masterful communication. When this state becomes your default mode of approaching every communication, you effortlessly step into a natural flow. 

Developing your capacity for Relational Presence is like strengthening a muscle that has been neglected. Unlike the struggle that physical workouts are for many, this exercise is designed to be highly pleasurable. There may be some initial confusion, discomfort, self-doubt but hang in there and do the reps no matter how it feels or what you are thinking.  With practice you will find . . . 

* Speaking Circles support you to access your natural public presence, along with your capacity to unselfconsciously express passion and purpose.

* Reach hearts, minds and souls every time through the practice of being in a Speaking Circle.

* Transmit your message and content with ease to groups of any size by practicing attunement with one listener at a time.

* Give up conventional notions of "public speaking" and discover the magic of authentic intimacy with audiences.

results.name: Deepening into Speaking From Presence

results.description:
Join us at Sunset Grill & Tap on Thursday 1/7 as Dogfish Head brings some amazing rare beers for their tap takeover! Nine great beers will be available for your drinking pleasure. No matter what style you prefer - they will have something for you. Make sure you RSVP ASAP as you know this event will be popular! 

• Be one of the very few to try the exceptionally rare, 18% World Wide Stout, which was once the strongest beer in the world. Brewed with a ridiculous amount of barley and six different yeast strains over seven months and then aged for half a year, it developed rich, roasty flavors of port wine, dark fruit, and much more!

• Have a glass of Dogfish Head's 120 Min IPA on draft. Called the holy grail for hop-heads, this beast of a beer is extremely rare in MA, so don't miss out! Last time we had it, the keg kicked in 30 minutes!

•  Ever tried a porter that was brewed with real lobsters? Try the Choc Lobster! It's a very rare robust porter that has chocolaty porter flavor but ends with distinct tastes of the sea. 

With so many amazing Dogfish Head beers to try this is not an event you will want to miss. Show up on time if you want to guarantee you get to try your favorites!
results.name: Dogfish Head Rare Beer Night: 18% World Wide Stout, 120 Min IPA & Choc Lobster!

Members pay $10 as on Monday night, non-member drop-in is $25.  Membership fee for each month of $25 brings discounts on drawing and painting sessions and classes.  Pay membership fee online (see left-hand column) via paypal or credit card, or in person with cash or check.  First session of the month would therefore be $35 ($25 membership fee plus $10 session fee) and each session thereafter would be $10. 

Thanks!

Finally: Give Tools to move you beyond Limiting Beliefs 

Love & Gratitude

Ellen

results.description:
Ongoing class in Medieval and Renaissance Longsword in the tradition of Johannes Lichtenauer.


The Longsword is the iconic fantasy Knight's sword - a two-handed, straight blade with a cross guard. The weapon may seem to be simple at first but is in reality a weapon of finesse and skill.


The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed.


All classes begin with a Strength & Conditioning program designed to physically prepare one for fighting with the sword. Elements develop agility, core stability and power.
results.name: Lichtenauer Longsword

results.description:
ANOMALISA TICKETS

I posted this event based on the following eMail from IFF Boston:

Breaking News:
ANOMALISA
This Thursday, January 7 – 7:30pm at the Kendall.

Directors Charlie Kaufman and Duke Johnson will join us directly after the screening for a Q&A. 


I have been informed by Kendall Square Cinema that the film will start at 8:30pm with Q&A following the film. They were unaware of the IFF miscommunication and are taking steps to correct the mistake.

Kendall Square Cinema directed me to Customer Service for a full refund.

I regret that we will not have a shared cinematic experience that would have undoubtedly been the best thus far in 2016.  


Michael Stone—husband, father and respected author of “How May I Help You Help Them?”—is a man crippled by the mundanity of his life. On a business trip to Cincinnati, where he's scheduled to speak at a convention of customer service professionals, he checks into the Fregoli Hotel. There, he is amazed to discover a possible escape from his desperation in the form of Lisa, an unassuming Akron baked goods sales rep who may or may not be the love of his life. A beautifully tender and absurdly humorous dreamscape, from the brilliant minds of Charlie Kaufman(Synecdoche, New York) and Duke Johnson (“Community” episode Abed's Uncontrollable Christmas), this stop-motion animation wonder features the vocal cast of Jennifer Jason Leigh, Tom Noonan and David Thewlis and a stirring strings-based score by Carter Burwell. The darkly comedic and surreal stop-motion journey of a man's long night of the soul, Anomalisa confirms Charlie Kaufman's place amongst the most important of American filmmakers, and announces Duke Johnson as a major creative force. Anomalisa, recent winner of the Best Animated Film prize from the Los Angeles Film Critics, received four Independent Spirit Awards nominations including Best Film, Best Director and Best Supporting Actress (Jennifer Jason Leigh) as well as a Golden Globe nomination for Best Animated Film.


See you at the movie,

John
results.how_to_find_us: This is not a Meetup.  This is to announce an Event with Director Present that starts too late for your intrepid host.
results.name: ANOMALISA -Directors Charlie Kaufman and Duke Johnson Present

results.description:
Hello everyone!
This month we will be talking about goals for the New Year. I know this may seem cliche but I'm really excited as I have some productivity worksheets and questionnaires we will be working on.
We will be talking through and discussing goals for our marriages, children, as well as personal and spiritual goals for ourselves. I have some wonderful resources to share with you all that include super helpful tips, ideas, and strategies. Sometimes we intend to spend time to think about these things, (to organize and plan it out), but lack the time and proper environment. Well this MOPS meeting will be just the thing. We will enjoy coffee, discussion, and hopefully you will leave inspired for the New Year! There will be a craft as well that you are sure to enjoy! If you all can do the following....
1. EMAIL me and reserve childcare so I can have the proper number of child care workers.
2. If you have not registered and paid the $25 MOPS annual fee please do so here https://www.easytithe.com/f/?k=PV6TAEPG0MB4WJXW.
This fee provides you with the following:
- The book Real Moms... Real Jesus. A great resource on mothering and one that will be referenced a lot in our MOPS meetings. Here's the link. http://www.amazon.com/Real-Moms-Jesus-Friend-Understands/dp/0802483615/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1451577470&sr=8-1&keywords=real+moms+real+jesus
- Craft supplies for the crafts we do at our meetings
-Coffee for each of the meetings as well as occasional food and refreshments.
-special speaker fees and other expenses.
3. If you signed up for snack for this month can you email me to confirm you are bringing it. I seem to have lost the signup sheet. :) I'm so excited about this meeting!! Be sure to bring a pen and maybe a journal if you want to jot down some ideas ;) As always, please let me know if you have any questions! Have a Blessed and Happy New Year!!

Members (those paying the $25 monthly membership fee) may reserve a spot for $70, non-members for $85.    Four hours each Friday morning, 10:00- 2:00pm. You can come individual days by paying $15 (members) or $25 (non-members) for a single drop-in, but please consider paying for the full amount and committing to come!  It will help us to keep these long sessions going, and even if you pay for the whole session and don't come to all of them (often happens), you're getting a pretty square deal.  If you would like to pay online please do so at

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball.

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Friday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

6:30-7:30 pm - Welcome and Dinner

7:30-9:00 pm - Rev. Dr. Stephanie May and Dr. Corey Cutler 

9:00-9:30 pm - Silent Auction and Event Completion

_____________________________________________________

We serve women who want to develop their leadership skills so they can make a greater contribution to the world, have fulfilling work, and live a life they love.

_____________________________________________________

Participants will:

• Clarify their values.


• Identify goals that are consistent with their values.


• Have insight into what they want to lead and how they would do it.


______________________________________________________


Come with an idea of where you would like to be more of a leader.

We request Pre-Registration, please register.

______________________________________________________

Presenters:

Rev. Dr. Stephanie May

Stephanie is the Minister of the First Parish in Wayland, who seeks to foster a supportive community that journeys together in their search for meaning and spiritual connection. She earned a degree in philosophy from Wheaton College (IL), a Masters in Divinity from Princeton Theological Seminary, and a Doctorate in Theology from Harvard Divinity School. Her doctoral work focused on the intersection of religion and women, gender and sexuality studies. Prior to entering the ministry she served as a teaching fellow at Harvard College and Harvard Divinity School, and a Lecturer at both Brandeis and Boston College. 

Dr. Corey Cutler


Dr. Cutler is a hematologist / oncologist in Boston. He is a cancer specialist trained in blood disorders and the medical treatment of malignancies.  He is the recipient of funds raised at our silent auction.  

He will give an update on this year of progress.

_____________________________________________________

The Dream Factory Community has been serving local women for the past 11 years.  We specialize in empowering women to gain clarity, set goals and actions, be accountable for progress, and create a community of support.  Our New Year's Dinner, provides a platform for our members and guests to set their intentions for the upcoming year.   

This event always includes a silent auction for cancer research.

For More Info
results.how_to_find_us: www.dreamfactorycommunity.com
results.name: DreamFactory: It's Our Time to Lead (New Year's Dinner for Women)

Our January meetup will be at my house! Please send me a message if you plan to attend and I will send you the address. I live in East Dracut.

My dining room table can comfortably fit 8 sewing machines so feel free to bring your machine. There is an island in the kitchen (off of the dining room) that we can use for cutting and I will setup the iron and board.

I set the time as 6-9, but feel free to come and go as you can. I get home from work at 5:45, so just come after that! I will have snacks and drinks and we can order pizza or something to be delivered.

results.description:

The assortment of games usually includes:
Telestations
Pictionary
Family Feud
Outburst
Parchesi
Mexican Train Game
Apples to Apples
Fun group games, as well as smaller two and three person games like:
Scrabble
Chinese Checkers
Backgammom
Cribbage
and more!

There are usually several games of kitty whist going on as well as a few Michigan Rummy games.

For Michigan Rummy, you need to play with about $4 in nickels (no, the stakes are not high so you don't lose much; heck most people just about break even most of the time.) I bring bag of rolled nickels so if you forget yours, I can "sell" you some nickels!

results.description:
<em style="font-size : 16px">Although this event takes place every Friday, I am only scheduling the Meetup once a month, on the 2nd Friday. Please note that the actual wine tasting runs from 5pm to 8pm, but we will meet at 6pm!


Gary

A message from The Wine Bottega:

Join us for our weekly Friday night tasting. It's always something delicious, educational and interesting. You can sign up for our weekly e-mail to get the details! (See the bottom of the homepage)

A NOTE FROM THE ORGANIZER:

Okay... We all love free stuff. That's why we're members of this group! So I'm going to post this as a recurring weekly event, as long as people are enjoying it. This event runs from 5pm till 8pm, but you can go for as much or as little time as you want. Please use the message area below to post if you're looking for people to join you. There are many restaurants in the North End, too, so feel free to post dinner requests, too. Let's make this page a collaborative web site!

Happy Free Tasting!

Gary

PS - If you like wine tastings, don't forget to check out the Central Bottle events, as well!

PPS - Please note that I have automatic reminders for this event turned off, since it is a repeating event.
results.name: Free Wine Tasting at The Wine Bottega in the North End - 2nd Friday of the Month

Our location this week is Kresge 202 (remodeled classroom) in the most gracious and globally conscious Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health (HCSPH) where health-conscious and energy-conscious building and curriculum modifications have been made.

Until further notice, we're in Kresge 202, at the top of the open stairwell near the guard's desk near the Countway Courtyard entrance to the Kresge Building.

All attendees need to register IN ADVANCE to get an HSPH building permission for the night.

E-Mail [masked] to register your intent AND sign YES on this meetup.

下午6点到晚上8点3

PLEASE (try to) request by 4 pm the day before the Tuesday evening event. 

* Harvard Square to LMA is about 30 minutes on #66 bus or M2 Harvard bus 
* Green Line E-Line comes to Brigham Circle, then walk BACK to crosswalk, then to the building 
* Walking from the Orange Line takes about 5-10 minutes, via Tremont Street to Brigham Circle 
* Walking from Brookline is about 10 minutes - via Huntington Avenue or Longwood Avenue 
* MFA, NEU, Wentworth, and Colleges of the Fenway are adjacent - on or off Huntington Avenue 
* Route 9 comes right into the area, via Brookline - passes Huntington Avenue D-line stop 
* Street parking is FREE from 6 pm onward (but not always easy to find)

Show your CURRENT LOCAL ID to the HSPH Security Guard on duty, then walk up the open indoor stairwell near the Kresge security guard, then straight up the stairwell, then turn left to Kresge 202 (follow signs to Kresge 202).

E-Mail [masked] 
for a building pass if you don't have a Harvard ID; we convene in Kresge 201; 
you may wish to ask the HCSPH security guard how to access Kresge 201

PLEASE plan to show up early so we can begin our 'bilingual introductions' on time, so our presenter can begin (and end) on time.

results.description:
Another night of great inspiration, cool company, and new stories from makers in Boston, Cambridge, Somerville, and environs. For the 6th year, Common Cod is sponsoring Ignite Craft Boston, where up to 20 creative souls will share their passion for their crafts with a like-minded, crafty audience.

Around the world, folks have been putting together Ignite events to show what they’re doing. The Ignite motto is “Enlighten us, but make it quick,” so each speaker has 20 photos or other visuals that automatically advance every 15 seconds, totaling 5 minutes. At Ignite Craft Boston, we’ll get to see all sorts of amazing, eye-opening DIY in only 90 minutes. Past talks can be seen on the Cod YouTube channel. Tickets are free, but seating is limited. Get your tickets here https://www.eventbrite.com/e/ignite-craft-boston-2016-tickets-19712377251
RSVPING HERE DOES NOT COUNT AS A TICKET

results.description:
How can games help us build community? 


We'll get together to play a cooperative table game.  This could involve rethinking and changing rules of a game that's more competitive.  We'll take time to consider ways we are perpetuating white supremacy culture and ways we can counter that.  Note: we may not have time to complete the game!  This is about process.


This time we'll play the cooperative game Pandemic.


We'll provide some snacks, and you can feel free to bring your dinner to eat here. 


Accessibility Information: Community Change, Inc. is wheelchair accessible with the following limitations.  The door to the building is heavy and does not have a button to open it. The elevator doors are slightly more than 30 inches wide.  The fourth floor bathrooms are not wheelchair accessible, but the first floor bathroom is.  Please let us know your needs so we can help make the event accessible for you.
results.name: Cooperative Game Night

results.description:
PLEASE DO NOT DOUBLE RSVP! ----PLEASE RSVP IN ONE GROUP ONLY!! Join the legendary crazy dancing at our Mix +Mingle Meetup Private Party for 120+ members with our own DJ, dance area, 2 bars +apps/food from 7-9PM.

7-9PM is the Social Mixer which the best because it allows you to get to know your fellow Meetup members. After 9PM the crazy dancing + loud music starts so please do not complain, since members come to dance to loud music after 9PM. Bonus FREE KARAOKE on 1st floor if you want to kick it KARAOKE style.

Its the party everyone loves since its he starting point for thousands of new friendships, real long term relationships and 57+ marriages. Remember this is not a Singles Party it's a Social party.

The BEST part!...Come between 7 and 8:20PM to get 1 included (FREE) drink ticket good for any beer, wine, or mixed drink! (Sorry no shots or top-shelf liquor). This 1 Drink ticket will expire at 8:20PM sharp!!.....Please don't forget to TIP your bartender for the included drink! When you arrive please head upstairs, (please don't block the stairway). Meet/greet Biagio, say your first name, what group you're with, pay with a $10 bill in hand at the top of the stairs (no $1 or $5 bills, please). You'll get a wrist bands to so you can go upstairs and downstairs.

1. Biagio collects $10 cash from everyone, but the invited Larger Meetup Group Head Organizers and some of the Social Fun Organizers..

2. After 9 PM you'll have to pay the bar's cover charge, so stretch your dollar and come before 9PM. If you get in before 9PM you ONLY have to pay $10 to Biagio.

I hope you can all join us for this blast of a party. It should be fun so thanks and enjoy life!..........Ciao, Biagio (a new dad)

==========================================================

Parking for this event: Street parking can be tough so you can try it and of course it's hit or miss. Your best bet it take the T. The closet T stop is the Aquarium stop on the Blue line, next would be State Street stop on the Orange line.

If you really must drive in and park then there is $10 Parking after 5PM and on weekends at International Place Garage . There is a coupon that lowers it to $7 but this $7 coupon is accepted at Pay Station in building lobby ONLY. http://bostonparking.spplus.com/Boston-1-International-Place-Parking.html

results.description:
Meetup at MetroRock Gym in Everett, offering both toprope and lead


Meet at the left-side hexagonal picnic table next to the bench and cubbies.

I (Jens) will go up to the picnic table area from 7 - 7:15 PM to meet people who prefer to show up at the regular MeetUp time. Please check  the whiteboard near the bathrooms for a description of what I'm wearing. If anyone else arrives early, please write "MEETUP" and your name & what you are wearing on the Whiteboard.

If you have not already done so, please post a clear face picture of yourself on your profile so that I and other members can recognize you.

If arriving later, just come find us on the walls. Hopefully you can recognize me (see "Event Host" right) from my picture.

If you've never climbed here before, you'll need to take & pass a belay test for rope climbing. Call the gym or see the website below for more info. Full-access Day Pass $22. Bouldering-Only Pass $18. Free pizza for students.

More info and directions: http://www.metrorock.com/

results.description:
This meetup is sponsored by a spinoff group of Plant Pure Nation, and will be joined also by members of various other Meetup groups.

     Come join us for a screening of Forks Over Knives, a fairly recent documentary exploring the relationships between what we eat, our weight, and our health--and what we can do about it.  Here is a trailer on the movie: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O7ijukNzlUg

     If you think you are doomed to be overweight, and have tried every diet in the book, you might consider this alternative approach to the problem. Because it works!  And it's the basis of everything I've been teaching.

     See you there!

Al

results.description:
DELICIOUS DINNER

(and Take-Out)

Prepared by

DAVID SNIECKUS

- MACROBIOTIC CHEF AND COUNSELOR - At 7 p.m.

at David’s, Margaret’s and Abigail's home in Newton, MA

January 8, 2016 Menu

Lentil Soup

Kasha and Onions with Carrots and Corn

Fried Tempeh

Smashed Squash

Kale and Broccoli

Salad

Pickled Daikon

Carrot Cake

Kukicha Tea

(See dinner logistics below.)

*****************************

Followed by Shamanic Journeying for the New Year

with Margaret Arndt at 8:30 pm

Margaret will speak about Shamanic Journeying and facilitate an experiential Shamanic Journey, an ancient and world-wide practice of accessing the non-physical realms of spirit - also known as non-ordinary reality - for healing, transformation, and our soul evolution. Journeying to non-ordinary reality enables the journeyer to open up channels of sensitivity and reconnect with one's animal and spirit teachers and helpers in order to access information, guidance, and healing.

In developing awareness of and connection with the spiritual nature of all things, we further our self-understanding and become better prepared to reclaim our spiritual power.

Margaret Arndt has been Shamanic Journeying since 1998, inspired by her work with John Perkins and Oscar Miro Quesada, is a certified Agent of Conscious Evolution through trainings with Barbara Marx Hubbard, a member of Conscious Evolution Boston <a>www.consciousevolutionboston.org,</a> a holistic consultant <a>www.sageconsultingresource.com,</a> and a co-host of this meet-up.

*********************************************************

Most ingredients are organic and of the highest standards.

Come be in community and enjoy a healthy meal!

Call (617)[masked] or e-mail [masked]
for reservations and directions.

Please rsvp no later than noon on Friday.

Sliding scale of $20 - $35/meal.

(Note: Preferred payment is by cash or check.)
(Let David know if interested in helping him cook in exchange for a free meal. Prerequisite: One of David's cooking classes, unless experienced.)

(Please contact us if you'd like to lead a discussion opener based upon a topic of your choice.)

Feel free to pass on to other friends and kindred spirits!

results.description:
This is a wonderful theme to move into the New Year with: Connecting to Your Inner Power to Create! Three guided meditations will build upon each other to a deeply inspiring and exciting crescendo of positive feelings for your future. Here's a peek at what we'll be doing:

"I am the space for...." Changing your story from inside the vortex of love Fast forwarding your dream To encourage and support your practice and our community, if you pay for 4 sessions, the fee will be only $60 (in-person, cash or check), to be used within 4 months of your payment.  You can also choose to pay for one class at a time for $20. These fees help to cover all of my costs and the significant time I put into running and preparing for all of the events and the meetup itself. Thank you!

Please RSVP each time you want to attend. RSVP is recommended and appreciated, as well as showing up or changing your RSVP in a timely manner. Feel free to invite family and friends, too!

Here's the basic description and format for all of our meditation sessions, with a more specific focus/theme each time we meet, as well. Of course, you do not have to commit to attending every time, however, the more you attend, the more you will benefit; and the better we'll get to know each other!

Guided Meditations for Experiencing Greater Inner Peace, Love, Ease and JOY!

Are you aware of the many benefits of meditating, but can’t get yourself to do it, or it’s too difficult to do on your own?

Do you enjoy the collective energy and ease of guided group meditations?

Meditation can be one of the easiest and most effective means to living with greater harmony, happiness and well-being. It’s also an opportunity to peacefully transform your problems, your fears, and any pain and stress in your life into something more positive.

I also consider meditating one of the most direct and easiest ways to connect to your greater Spirit-Self, and to access all that it has to offer you.

By participating in these group guided meditations, you’ll experience how simple,delightful and easy it can be. You’ll learn and practice:

• Simple yet profound techniques you can easily do for yourself for any length of time that is comfortable for you.

• How to easily get into a meditative state to deeply relax and to create positive, pleasurable feelings, including inner peace, love, ease and joy; and how to bring that into your daily living.

• Techniques to help you release stress and anxiety, and to shift your perspective and experience of those issues, and to shift to a more positive perspective, instead.

• How to connect to your inner resources and your best self, to solution consciousness, and how to activate your body's natural healing response.

We have a different theme each time we meet to help build and reinforce positive thinking patterns, beliefs and inner narratives that will support you in living with greater inner peace, love, ease and joy.

We typically have 2-3 guided meditations, with discussion and instruction in between to help you carry the positive feelings and lessons experienced into your day and life.

This is a perfect time to let go of stress and "busy-ness", and to fully let go and relax into bliss. Come with whatever intentions suit you, and the evening is still sure to satisfy. It always works out magically that way.

You're encouraged to bring a journal or notebook and pen to class.

To encourage and support your practice, if you pay for 4 sessions, the fee will be only $60 (in-person, cash or check), to be used within 4 months of your payment.  Or, you can pay for one class at a time for $20.  Just RSVP each time you want to attend. RSVP is recommended and appreciated, as well as showing up or changing your RSVP in a timely manner.

“I'm leaving refreshed, optimistic, empowered, full of love, and excited about bringing more spirit into everything I do. I’m sure that practicing the techniques I learned tonight will help me very much. Thank you!!! "

"Great meditations! I had a marvelous experience with each of them and a lot to take with me: powerful imagery, good feelings, and new techniques for connecting myself with the Universe. Loved the “love ripple”!”

"I truly value our time together. I tried two other guided meditation classes with other instructors, and I enjoy your classes the most. Why? Because you give us time to reflect, journal and share. It really helps to deepen my experience and expand my perspective. And honestly, I relate more to your meditations and love the sound of your voice. Your guided meditations are like group therapy for the soul."

Class leader (and meetup organizer): Ann Ide, M.A., has been leading guided meditation classes for years, and is also a certified master practitioner in Neuro-linguistic Programming and Hypnotherapy, and certified NLP Life Coach. Ann coaches people to move beyond their personal struggles, to new levels of harmony, happiness and success. With her expert questioning, inner exploration processes and personal change interventions, clients become able to more easily create the happiness they desire.

results.description:
JERMAINE FOWLER: Give ‘Em Hell Tour

Jermaine Fowler (TruTV's Friends of the People and MTV's Guy Code) has been touring the country since he was 21 with Comedy Central, MTV, College Humor, and Funny or Die. This January he sets to embark on his own nation-wide tour in celebration of his debut comedy special, Give Em Hell, Kid.

Raised in Hyattsville, Maryland, Jermaine began performing stand-up in 2006 while still in high school. On his 20th birthday he moved to NYC on a Megabus with three pieces of luggage and a dream. Before building a buzz with stand-up, Jermaine was featured in promos for McDonalds, Sobe, and Sports Illustrated. In 2012, Jermaine was one of the “New Faces” at the Just For Laughs Montreal Comedy Festival and was invited back the following year to tape Funny as Hell for HBO. He’s toured nationally with College Humor, Comedy Central on Campus, and has one half of the internet sketch group BodegaCat Sanchez, alongside Kevin Barnett. He’s been featured on two seasons of MTV2′s Guy Code, @Midnight, and “Comedy Underground with Dave Attell”. Now he’s the co-creator, writer, and star of a new TV series, “Friends of The People” Tuesdays on TruTV. Now in LA, his stand up has been featured on the Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson and has a development deal with ABC to create his own sitcom.

The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson:
https://youtu.be/0Op6psTwu4Y

Website: http://www.jermainefowler.com/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/jermaine.fowler
Twitter: https://twitter.com/jermaineFOWLER
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/jermainefowler/

https://youtu.be/aVaYfGFIdTI

$12 advanced $15 at the door 18+

FB: https://www.facebook.com/events/911491602265738/911496215598610/

results.description:
The Southwest region of France is peppered with a wide variety of vineyards that flourish in the inland hills, sheltered from the Atlantic. Vines were cultivated here a thousand years before Bordeaux because the climate could provide wines of greater strength. Even after the rise of Bordeaux, the Sud-Ouest's international reputation surpassed Bordeaux to the point that the Bordelaise ultimately conspired to close their markets. Thus today, the wines of the Southwest remain hidden treasures. Let's see what we can uncover!

The Sud-Ouest encompasses a heterogeneous array of sub-regions that produce red, white, and rosé, as well as sweet whites. You're welcome and encouraged to bring whatever interests you, though the best wines are usually the reds of Cahors, Madiran, and Fronton, where the Malbec, Tannat, and the wildly distinctive Negrette varietals, respectively, are grown. Other notable place-names to seek out include Irouléguy, Gaillac, Marcillac, Pacherenc du Vic-Bilh, Cotes de Gascogne, the Bordeaux-like Bergerac and Cotes du Marmandais, and the sweet wines of Jurançon and Monbazillac. Plan to spend between $15-$25 for these well-priced wines.


Please bring your wine in a paper wine bag, 4 glasses, and some food to share.
results.name: Southwest France for the Winter

results.description:
What better way to start the new year clean than with a sound bath!


Come help me ring in the new year with my tibetan bowls and their new friends: a gong and a crystal bowl :)

So if you come to the Buddhist Temple for a sound healing, what can you expect? 


When you come in, you take your shoes off, then you walk to the Dharma Hall which will be on your immediate right at the top of the stairs. We'll start with a short introduction and discuss each of our intentions for how we want to work with the sound and then meditate for a few minutes to tune into each of our specific intentions. The general theme will be new years resolutions - specifically bringing in the vibrations we need! Then, everyone will sit or lie down on super comfy pillow mats (bring your own blanket) and we'll begin our journey into sound.

I start by playing the 500 pound cast-iron temple bell and then I move into the sweet sounds of my Tibetan singing bowls. What follows, I can't exactly say, as the sound decides what it wants to say. But you can expect to hear the rainbow voice, the sound of the overtone chant singing with the tibetan bowls. You won't be able to tell which is which but this is all part of the dance. You will even feel what it's like to have the bowls played on you as the sound moves your energy where it needs to go. Tingshas, tuning forks, rattles and more are all part of the play as the sound moves you to rest at your destination without ever having moved. So, please, come and feel something unique. You never leave anywhere exactly the same, but when it comes to sound healing, you will leave sounding more like yourself :)

Pllease bring a blanket to enhance the comfort of your experience! Offerings are freely accepted :)


Much love,


Brian Russo

(781)[masked]

[masked]
results.name: Ringing in the New Year Sound Healing

results.description:
Tired of using a mouse and screen for sound design?  No time to get into the studio and sample? Want to work on sound design with your friends?  Turns out you have one of the most powerful sound design tools sitting in your pocket.  Andrew Hlynsky is back from Valencia Spain to bring you a very special workshop.  He will be going over how to sound design on IOS devices (Audiobus, Moog, Sugar Bytes, Hosaki, and Korg apps) and set up cloud based sample libraries you can contribute to with your friends.

Andrew Hlynsky is a drummer, sound designer and electronic musician.  He has been using Ableton Live for nine years and teaching for two.  He has also worked extensively as a sound designer and product developer working on libraries for NI’s Kontakt, the Akai MPC, and the Sonivox Playa series.  Andrew caters his teaching style to the needs and goals of the individual student. He focuses on developing proper workflow and compositional environments that facilitate expressive and efficient music making.

Facebook Event Page: https://www.facebook.com/events/984428518262360/

Get your free tickets and RSVP here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/mobile-cloud-collaborative-sound-design-18-free-tickets-20440957454
results.name: Mobile & Cloud Collaborative Sound Design [1/8] #FREE

with Margaret Arndt at 8:30 pm

Margaret will speak about Shamanic Journeying and facilitate an experiential Shamanic Journey, an ancient and world-wide practice of accessing the non-physical realms of spirit - also known as non-ordinary reality - for healing, transformation, and our soul evolution. Journeying to non-ordinary reality enables the journeyer to open up channels of sensitivity and reconnect with one's animal and spirit teachers and helpers in order to access information, guidance, and healing.

In developing awareness of and connection with the spiritual nature of all things, we further our self-understanding and become better prepared to reclaim our spiritual power.

Margaret Arndt has been Shamanic Journeying since 1998, inspired by her work with John Perkins and Oscar Miro Quesada, is a certified Agent of Conscious Evolution through trainings with Barbara Marx Hubbard, a member of Conscious Evolution Boston <a>www.consciousevolutionboston.org,</a> a holistic consultant <a>www.sageconsultingresource.com,</a> and a co-host of this meet-up.

results.description:
PLEASE DO NOT DOUBLE RSVP! ----PLEASE RSVP IN ONE GROUP ONLY!! 

Join the legendary crazy dancing at our Mix +Mingle Meetup Private Party for 120+ members with our own DJ, dance area, 2 bars +apps/food from 7-9PM.

7-9PM is the Social Mixer which the best because it allows you to get to know your fellow Meetup members. After 9PM the crazy dancing + loud music starts so please do not complain, since members come to dance to loud music after 9PM.

Bonus FREE KARAOKE on 1st  floor if you want to kick it KARAOKE style.

Its the party everyone loves since its he starting point for thousands of new friendships, real long term relationships and 57+ marriages. Remember this is not a Singles Party it's a Social party.

The BEST part!...Come between 7 and 8:20PM to get 1 included (FREE) drink ticket good for any beer, wine, or mixed drink! (Sorry no shots or top-shelf liquor). This 1 Drink ticket will expire at 8:20PM sharp!!.....Please don't forget to TIP your bartender for the included drink! 

When you arrive please head upstairs, (please don't block the stairway). Meet/greet Biagio, say your first name, what group you're with, pay with a $10 bill in hand at the top of the stairs (no $1 or $5 bills, please). You'll get a wrist bands to  so you can go upstairs and downstairs.

1. Biagio collects $10 cash from everyone, but the invited Larger Meetup Group Head Organizers and some of the  Social Fun Organizers..

2. After 9 PM you'll have to pay the bar's cover charge, so stretch your dollar and come before 9PM. If you get in before 9PM you ONLY have to pay $10 to Biagio.

I hope you can all join us for this blast of a party. It should be fun so thanks and enjoy life!..........Ciao, Biagio (a new dad)

==========================================================

Parking for this event: Street parking can be tough so you can try it and of course it's hit or miss. Your best bet it take the T.

The closet T stop is the Aquarium stop on the Blue line, next would be State Street stop on the Orange line.

If you really must drive in and park then there is $10 Parking after 5PM and on weekends at International Place Garage . There is a coupon that lowers it to $7 but this  $7 coupon is accepted at Pay Station in building lobby ONLY.  http://bostonparking.spplus.com/Boston-1-International-Place-Parking.html

results.description:
Mary Sacksteder of JP started a Plant Pure Nation Pod in JP, which gets together on the 2nd and 4th Friday of the month at Spontaneous Celebration in JP. 

In January, she will show two (2) recent vegan videos food and health.


* January 8: "Forks Over Knives"
* January 22: "PlantPure Nation"

This is opportunity for each of you to watch each of these videos for free - at no cost, and to discuss them together.
Recently, viewers of PlantPure Nation were charged $20 to see the video.
results.name: JP PlantPure Nation Pod:   "Forks Over Knives"

results.description:
Here's the game plan:

7:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

7:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

7:20 - Play!!!!!!

9:00 - Conclude the meetup and begin socializing.

Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a light or dark "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!
results.how_to_find_us: The field is right next to Alewife station on the Red Line. There is also plenty of parking provided no one else is using the field. (Not an issue in the winter.)
results.name: Friday Night Time Ultimate @ Russell Field

results.description:
Please join us to watch and discuss the first episode of BELIEF, a groundbreaking 7-part documentary series that aired on the OWN network in October.

BELIEF is an exploration of the power of our diverse belief systems, faith practices and cultural traditions that connect us to ourselves, sustain us through the most challenging times and bind us closer together in community with one another. Oprah has described this series as the very reason she founded a television network - to be able to share stories that connect people together.

This series highlights stories of people from around the world, diverse in their beliefs, but united by a deep desire to find purpose and meaning in their lives. It journeys to the far reaches of the world, illuminating sacred places and practices that will engage believers of any faith or none at all.

Our goal is that engaging in these questions and conversations together draws us to a place of deepened intercultural understanding and greater healing. Our hope is that this series can act as a catalyst to start and/or deepen intercultural and interfaith communication, trust building and partnership.

The gathering is free of charge. A facilitated discussion will follow the episode, inviting you to explore the beliefs and practices that bring meaning to your own life.

For more information about the series, or to watch the 2-minute trailer, visit http://beliefteam.com/
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be right in the sanctuary...come in through the large glass doors in the front of the spiritual center on 13 Common Street in Natick Center across from the town green.
results.name: Community Watch Party: What Do You Believe?

results.description:
A Puja, in Sanskrit, means reverence, honor, worship and adoration.  It's used by the Hindus, Sikhs, Buddhists, and others -- as a ceremony to honor a very special occasion; it's also used more often as part of a sacred ritual/practice to support opening to the wisdom of the Divine -- your Source.  


_________________________________________

Here's what we are going to do:

_________________________________________

Intimate Puja Circles, created by Robyn, of Come Back to Love, will be the place to:

• Be playful with other yummy, juicy, soulful singles, and couples

• Learn and practice Tantra, yoga, meditation - the principles and practices of Sacred Sexuality

• Be in a room with folks who are willing to be honest, and open their hearts

• Experience deep connections with those interested in sacred sexuality, expanded orgasm, conscious relationship, spirituality  - people like YOU!

Tantra (whether you are single or in relationship):

This special evening will begin with many invitations to connect with each other in light and playful ways -- always with the opportunity to go as deep as you choose.  Single or coupled, you'll experience Tantric Speed Dating as a way to say 'hello', get to know one another, mingle and connect.

Here's what Participants are saying!

"The class was great; I  really enjoyed it. Very different from my normal way of life, you did create on a small scale what I was hoping for....creating the possibility to feel a deeper intimacy."

"It's so amazing to walk into a room of "strangers" and walk out feeling in love with everyone!"

"I didn't think I'd be able to connect with anyone there.  I was so surprised, and delighted, how easy it was to enjoy myself with every man in that room! Thank you Robyn, for your excellent facilitation skills. I felt totally safe!"

"We have to wait a whole month until the next one????"

"This is a very special event; a non-threatening, yet deep and authentic way to meet others. I've been online dating for years and it's just not for me.  I've met some really good people at your events."

"We love to come as a couple and meet others on a similar path."

The Intimate Puja Circle</a><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=SHVW639WM28LC"><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=ZES8HVDSP97PA"></a> itself will begin part-way through the night during which you'll have the chance to connect more deeply with others (one-on-one) -- this part of the evening will be facilitated, with a structure offered, however, you will have ample time to co-create with the beloved in front of you!!  You will be at choice and encouraged to ask for 100% of what you want.


Relax on a Friday night:

Once the formal part of the evening is over, there'll be time to dance, hang out, cuddle, snuggle, relax, process, and rest.  There will always be chocolate!


Q&A

1. What if I'm in relationship? Being in relationship definitely does not exclude you from coming to the Intimate Puja Circle.  These rituals will be invitations to connect with yourself and one another - and you will be at choice as to how you do that.  There are typically a mix of singles and couples at the events.

2.  What should I wear? Please be comfortable but also celebratory!  Wear yoga pants or something with a draw string around the waist; bring sarongs, scarves, dresses, etc.

3.  Do I need to bring anything? Yes, FRIENDS!!  And your water bottle.  You are also welcome healthy snacks to share after the Puja.  Organic fruit and chocolate are best.

4.  What if I have questions, I'm feeling a bit nervous:  Please email me to set up a time to talk:  [masked]

Westminster Choir
Joe Miller, conductor

From old-time gospel hymns to the exquisite setting of Poulenc’s Mass in G Major, the expressive singing of the Westminster Choir will offer a concert connecting community through words and music. The innovative program will center around Francis Poulenc’s monumental Mass in G Major, whose movements will serve as a frame upon which a musical tapestry will be woven of works by Debussy, Brahms, Dawson and Antognini. A connecting thread will be the traditional American hymn O Come, Angel Band:

O, come, angel band,
Come and around me stand;
O, bear me away on your snowy wings
To my eternal home.

“This music centers around our shared experiences,” says Maestro Joe Miller. “The words of the Mass have been used for centuries to bring people together. Kyrie, Gloria, Sanctus, Benedictus, and Agnus Dei represent parts of worship, but they also represent the experiences that we share as humans. Centering around Poulenc’s great Mass in G Major, this program is grouped into music that reflects the emotions and memories of the choir, the members of the audience and our community.”

Free Will Offering
results.name: Westminster College Choir Tour - concert

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and shared energy. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in Boston?

At TurnON, we play three communication games, and you can participate at whatever level feels good to you. Imagine meeting new people in an environment where they feel comfortable to be themselves; a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation. That's what we have created.

TurnON events give you the opportunity to look deeper into yourself, through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses. What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to be authentic. It's like a giant exhale when the rest of the world is asking you to hold it in. In just an hour, you may even forget that you are in Boston.

TurnON Boston is an organization that teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. At the end of the evening, we will give you a brief description of the practice of Orgasmic Meditation and information on where to learn more. The games we play at TurnON events are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without actually doing the practice (or touching anyone, or removing any clothing!).

$10, payable at the door.

Please arrive on time - we lock the door promptly at 7:40!

Limited non-resident parking is available alongside our building on Dudley Street, or plentiful metered spaces on Mass Ave are only one block away (and free after 6pm). We are a 10-minute walk from the Red Line at Davis Square.


 http://tedxtalks.ted.com/video/TEDxSF-Nicole-Daedone-Orgasm--2
results.how_to_find_us: Entrance is on the corner of Cedar and Dudley Streets.
results.name: TurnON Boston

results.description:
Friday nights are generally for more experienced students, as we work through some different parts of Fiore's works in a more open format.  New students should take our beginners' class first, or contact our instructors for more information.  We're happy to have visiting scholars from other programs come and play!

We practice L'Arte D'Armizare (The Art of Bearing Arms), a historical European martial art. Our main sources of interpretation are the books (c[masked]) of Fiore dei Liberi, a fencing master from Friuli (thus the non-standard Italian spellings!).

Our students work on a combination of longsword, abrazzare (grappling), daga (dagger/knife) and other weapon skills. These skills are drawn from direct translation from historical sources, developed through multiple physical interpretations and tested at speed. Though we emphasize historical technique, our training sessions are a blend of warmup, interpretation, drill, and for men and women who've passed our safety standards, both focused and open sparring.

results.description:
Welcome future dance-a-holics!! Come dance with us THIS FRIDAY! If you want to learn to social dance and have a blast while doing it, please join us for a night of west coast swing. We offer a beginner ("Level 1", meant for those with little/no experience), intermediate ("Level 2", meant for those who have mastered the Left Side Pass, Right Side Pass, and Sugar Push), and advanced ("Level 3", meant for those who have mastered whips, tucks, and fundamental techniques) classs from 8:30-9:30pm. If you like it and feel like sticking around, there is a west coast social dance from 9:15-12pm.

You don't need a partner.

You don't need to have any previous dance experience.

You can have two left feet.

This is all about having a blast while learning something new that you can actually use in your real life!

WHAT IS WEST COAST SWING?

West Coast Swing (WCS) is a modern, partnered social dance done all over the world.

It is danced to a wide variety of music, including R&B, Rock, Blues, country and Lyrical: exactly what’s on the radio today and at functions you attend!

It fits in small spaces like bars, crowded dance floors—even your living room.

You do not need a partner to get started.  Most people come by themselves or with friends.

Once you’re hooked, there are places to dance WCS every night of the week in the Boston area.

People of all ages dance WCS.

results.description:
Event Organizer: Michael Blair @ (978)[masked]


=====

Read the entire description before you RSVP and answer all of the questions that are part of the process. Failure to answer them will result in your removal from this event.

Answers DO NOT carry over from one event to another so you must answer them for EACH EVENT. Also, questions might not show up if you RSVP from a phone or tablet so if you don't see them you will need to use a computer.

If you underestimate the demands of this event; overestimate your experience, knowledge, skills or abilities; or come unprepared you put yourself and others at risk. Consider this before you RSVP.

=== What We're Doing ===

The plan is to hike to three of the 4,000 footers in New Hampshire - Madison, Adams, and Jefferson. We will use Lowe's Path and Randolph Path to get to Jefferson and then head over to Adams and Madison before coming down on Valley Way. The AMC's Madison Spring Hut is closed for the season).

If you are interested in participating in this event sign up for the waiting list. I will add people that (1) answer all of the questions that are part of the RSVP process and (2) have done similar hikes within the past three months.

RSVPs close 24 hours before the event.

The maximum group size for this trip will be 10 people. 

Guests aren't permitted.

Dogs are only permitted with prior approval of the event organizer.

=== Trip Summary ===

We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Our pace will be that of the slowest hiker. This trip isn't for you if you are faster than the group and don't want to stay with us, if you want to head off on your own, or if you are slower than the group and expect us to constantly wait for you.

On this moderate pace (~2.0 MPH) trip we will hike about 13.3 miles and climb about 6,100 feet. It should take an average hiker about 10 hours to complete. This event is considered ADVANCED because of the pace, distance, and elevation gain.

Use this link for more information about where we are going and how we will get there:

• http://trailsnh.com/peaks/nh/4000/2-Mt-Adams-5774--5-Mt-Madison-5367


• http://trailsnh.com/peaks/nh/4000/3-Mt-Jefferson-5712

Dangerous weather conditions will cancel this event - I will post an update and/or send an email to all confirmed participants.


Use this link for the current weather forecast:

• http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=44.320339409000496&lon=-71.29090635799963#.Voh8wDblw3I


=== What to Bring ===


Don't wear ANY cotton - this includes your socks and underwear. You will need winter hiking boots - if you wear them in the summer they aren't designed for winter use (e.g. insulation). You will need mountaineering snow shoes. Not all snowshoes are the same - some are designed for steep terrain with potentially deep snow while others aren't. These are the acceptable brands and models:

• Tubbs Flex ALP, Flex VRT, Flex TRK, or Mountaineers.

• MSR Lightening, Revo, or Evo. 

• TSL Symbioz Elite or Expert. 

• Atlas Aspect, Endeavor, or Series 10/11/12.

You will also need traction - while you can bring mountaineering crampons if you want I think all you will need is either Kahtoola Microspikes or Hillsound Trail Crampons.

Use this link for a list of items needed for a winter day hike:


• </a><a href="http://files.meetup.com/492954/Winter_Day_Hike_List_ADK.pdf">http://files.meetup.com/492954/Winter_Day_Hike_List_ADK.pdf

Do not rely on others to have extra items to share with you at the meeting spot or on the trail. You should know how to use all of your equipment - test and adjust it prior to this trip. 

=== Directions ===

We will meet at the Appalachia Trailhead which is located on the north side of Route 2 south of Gorham, NH. According to Google Maps this spot is about 170 miles from Boston and it will take about 2 hours 47 minutes to drive there. Since this is where we will end the day we will leave a few cars there and drive a short distance to the starting spot.

Use this link to customize the driving directions:

• https://goo.gl/maps/D2Qf9kmqmg72

While carpooling is encouraged you are responsible for coordinating your own rides. Use the comments section below to communicate with others who may also be looking to share a ride.

=== Random Group of Hikers Disclaimer ===

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hike Safe Responsibility Code; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

results.description:
Be part of creating a better future. 

A six-weekend format for the internationally-recognized full Permaculture Design Certificate Course (PDC), running January through May 2016 at the beautiful Boston Nature Center! 

Jan 9/10, Feb 6/7, Mar 5/6, April 2/3, Apr 30/May 1 + 3-day DESIGN PRACTICUM on May 20/21/22

This PDC is a great value:  13 full days, more than 120 direct contact hours with experienced permaculture designers, facilitators and teachers... all for about $100 per day! Discount ideas can be found below.

This course, which will carry an urban and suburban focus, is recommended for home-owners and renters, educators, school garden organizers, farmers and gardeners, activists, landscape professionals, planners, architects, engineers, tradespeople and anyone interested in charting a new course for themselves and their communities.

This course is co-sponsored by Mass Audubon's Boston Nature Center, The Boston Food Forest Coalition, and the Greater Boston Permaculture Guild.

FULL COURSE DETAILS BELOW

Expected Outcomes: 

• Gain a thorough understanding of permaculture origins, ethics, principles and design methodologies.

• Enhance your ability to build soil, capture water, reduce energy consumption, generate energy, grow and store food, read the landscape and create edible perennial ecosystems.

• Become a resource for your family and neighborhood, building resilience at the personal, household, enterprise and community levels.

• Be able to approach any piece of land and apply a permaculture design methodology and set of applied techniques to achieve increased resilience and true sustainability.

• Learn how to start transforming even challenging properties into healthy, high-yielding systems of abundance that require little to no fossil fuels.

• Change the way you view the challenges around you.

Read Testimonials from Past PDC Participants

2016 Boston Permaculture Design Course Details

Where: This course will take place at Mass Audubon's Boston Nature Center in Mattapan (Boston), MA; the site will also be base camp from which we'll make several field trips to sites relevant to permaculture.  Plenty of on-site parking.

When: This course will be held over the course of six weekends (including one final 3-day weekend), January through May 2016.
