results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 27-37 --SOLD OUT FOR MEN

results.description:
As we head into a new year, lots of us are going through our closets, basements, etc., and re-evaluating our relationship with stuff. Some folks are ruthless with the trash/recycle/rummage sale can, and others' (raising hand) hearts bleed with emotion as they once again pull out those high school yearbooks, first love letters, childhood toys, souvenirs, picture albums, etc. Is stuff an unnecessary burden that ties us to the past, or is it an essential window into the long view of our lives? Which things are worth keeping to you and add value to your life, and which encroach on your space and comfort?


Here's writer/designer Graham Hill arguing for less stuff and more happiness:

http://www.ted.com/talks/graham_hill_less_stuff_more_happiness#t[masked]


And of course, there's this classic from our late comedian friend George Carlin:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MvgN5gCuLac

There is parking available behind the restaurant and on the street. There are no parking restrictions on Sundays.


Hope to see you there :)
results.name: Stuff

results.description:
Sunday, January 10, 2016, AMC Cinema, 22 Flutie Pass, Framingham, MA - 7:00 p.m. show

This is a Movie Meetup to see “Star Wars: The Force Awakens,” at the AMC Cinema in Framingham.

The show starts at 7:00 p.m., so we’ll meet starting at 6:30 p.m. and go into the theatre at 6:45 p.m. We’ll meet in the first lobby, to the far right. I’ll be wearing a small “Meetup” badge.

After the movie, we'll gather right outside the theatre's entrance doors (where you go in to be seated, not the outside doors) to decide where we'll go for refreshments. Catch up with us there if you've arrived late or haven't found us.

The AMC is newly remodeled with cushy reclining seats. It’s assigned seating and it’s best to buy tickets online ahead of time because it’s not unusual for shows to sell out. So, attendees will need to do the following:

Go to: https://www.amctheatres.com/movie-theatres/boston/amc-framingham-16-with-dine-in-theatres

1. At the top of the list of movies and showtimes is a pull-down calendar. SET THE DATE TO THE CORRECT DATE or you’ll end up with tickets for a different date!
2. Scroll down to the movie and click on the correct time (7:00 p.m.).
3. Enter the quantity of tickets you want and click the button for “Add To Cart.”
4. Scroll to the top of the page and click on the icon for your cart.
5. Click the “Checkout” button.
6. If you’re a Stubs member, you’ll be able to log in, or click “Continue as Guest.” (Stubs membership is $9 per year. Stubs members aren’t charged the $1.25 convenience fee.)
7. On the right side of the page, click the button for “Select Seats.” The movie theatre is now all assigned seating. The seats in white are available.
8. Try to get seats in row L or row K. It’s likely that some of us won’t be sitting together. (The seats are so big it’s not that easy to talk to others anyway.) Click on a seat and then click the button for “Continue.”
9. You’ll be able to enter your payment information and then Complete Purchase.
10. On the next screen you can do any or all of these things: Print a copy of your ticket to bring with you, view the virtual ticket on your screen, or send a confirmation to your mobile phone via text (you can show them that when you get there). Please remember to update your RSVP if your plans change.

This event is posted in two different meetup groups.

Star Wars: The Force Awakens
Lucasfilm and visionary director J.J. Abrams join forces to take you back again to a galaxy far, far away as Star Wars returns to the big screen.

Rated: PG-13
Running Time: 2 hr 16 min
Genre: Adventure
Director: J.J. Abrams
Cast: Harrison Ford, Mark Hamill, Carrie Fisher, Adam Driver, Daisy Ridley, and John Boyega
Release Date: December 18, 2015
results.name: Movie Meetup: "Star Wars: The Force Awakens,” Sun., Jan. 10, Framingham

results.description:
Swing on round to where the Opry's grand and the BBQ sure ain't bland. Old School Game Show is sure to raise Hell and make sure the higher the hair, the closer to God. The gang's all here -- the Swinging Old School Game Show Band, the Cubic Zirconia Dancers, and special musical guest rodeo stars, The Darlings will be lassoing your hearts alongside comedic cowboy, Ken Reid! There will be enough hee haw ha ha's and comedy to raise Hank Williams outta that Cadillac and into your little pea pickin' hearts. Get your tickets to this trivia/comedy hoedown, cuz darlin', just bless your heart if you're not there.

OSGS is a live interactive theater experience done with all the pageantry and analog style of a 1970's television game show. The show combines elements of pub trivia, variety specials, and comedy sketches to produce a completely unique trivia experience. Participating audience members play to win fabulous individual game prizes from great local sponsors! It's all the fun of an afternoon spent rolling around in the rumpus room- without the rug burn.

Pssst, You can join the Alt Trivia Revolution here;
www.oldschoolgameshow.com

Tickets: http://americanrepertorytheater.org/events/show/old-school-game-shows-honky-tonkin-boot-scootin-hootenanny
results.name: Old School Game Show's "Honky Tonkin, Boot Scootin Hootenanny"

results.description:
• Sessions are booked using the Eventbrite link below.

• These are one on one sessions held  via a private telephone conference line. You can call in from your home or office.

• You can choose the time and day of your session.

• We review your dating profile together over the phone during our private session.

Are you sending message & after message on OKCupid or Match and not getting any responses?

Here's what we're going to do:

You and I are going to take a tour of your online dating profile via phone. I'll tell you if there are any red flags or bad buzzwords that might be keeping someone from hitting that message button. We'll look at your profile text, your photos and any other details that you share. We'll review everything together, and I'll tell you what might be sending the wrong impression. Or I'll tell you everything is perfect and you don't need to change a thing!

After this session, you're going to have more control and can go back to those days when you'd get excited before a first date. Just pick a time slot and register.

Get a 30 minute one on one review of your profile with me.  I’ll go over your picture selection and ad text and let you know if your profile includes any buzz words or red flags. I’ll also help you tweak/write your profile if it needs some freshening up.

I can also write your profile for you, if that's what you would prefer. See our other services here: http://andthatswhyyouresingle.com/work-with-me-get-more-dates/

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$35 for 30 Minute Profile Review Session (Must use code MEETUP at registration)

~~YOU NEED TO BOOK AND SCHEDULE YOUR OWN SESSION~~

BOOK YOUR SESSION HERE: https://oneononeprofilecritique.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

INCLUDES:

• Profile analysis (30 minute phone session.)

• Assistance with editing and re-writes

• Photo selection and review

• A review of online dating basics and how to attract more views to your profile

• How to craft better introductory messages to get more responses

• Feedback about specific issues and experiences

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
